metadata.novel_title: I Alone Am The SSS-Rank Regressor

novel_info.title: I Alone Am The SSS-Rank Regressor
novel_info.author: Tsukasa0
novel_info.summary: “How the hell is this possible?”Dead and betrayed in the snow with the rest of his squadron, Mikhail is surprised to find himself regressed in time.What's worse was that he had no idea how or why he regressed as his memories at the time of death were completely gone.With his element of Oath -the power to make vows in exchange for power- also now messed up, Squadron Leader Mikhail Hendrix must now navigate through this changed storyline with no clues at his disposal.He needs to try his best to keep his squadron alive in this dangerous world of gods and magic, all the while figuring about his regression and the woman.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Wake Me Up
chapters.content:
Chapter 1: Wake Me Up
"Wake up Mika, stop shaking it already!"
Two deep blue eyes opened as the voice echoed in the encampment.
The cold prickled against his skin, but the panic overcame the irritation.
His body shot up and his chest heaved up and down with large gasps.
The man looked to his side where he was faced by the black walls of the room.
"Nightmare?"
Another voice reached the man’s ears, softer and calmer.
A contrast to the previous one.
His head snapped to the front, coming face with two men in front of him.
Sleek black hair with tips falling down in front of his eyes, just like him. Red crimson eyes that shone as bright as the smile on his face.
Icarus Heliarke.
And the second man.
Unruly meadow green hair. Golden eyes that shone like the brightest amber and a calmness on his face that resembled the seas.
Modric Sylbane.
It took him not more than a second to recognize the two.
After all, how could he not?
They were his squadmates. The man looked at them with widened eyes.
The only problem was..
In a snap, the man grabbed the hand of Icarus, his fingers closing around it.
The cold seeped into his skin, sending a shiver down his body.
It was real and solid.
It wasn’t a dream.
’H-how? How are they...’
It was the only thought that ran through the 20 year old squadron commander, Mikhail Hendrix’s mind.
They were all supposed to be dead. He had seen it with his own eyes.
In fact...
Mikhail’s gaze went down to his own hands, both pale as snow and without a blemish.
He was supposed to be dead too.
Excluding the ragged furry clothes, there wasn’t a single injury on his body.
’How is this possible?’
Had he returned back in time?
There was no indication of what had happened.
Forcing himself to remember, Mikhail could still vividly remember the last moments of his life.
In the middle of a tundra, beyond the Ironhold.
Stranded with nowhere to go, surrounded by Sylaris.
The bodies of his dead squadmates in front of him, the pooling blood freezing beneath them.
Mikhail himself, on the verge of death.
And then...
’Huh?’
His memory ran blank. He was unable to remember anything that happened past that point.
’Urgh!’
Mikhail tried to push further but to no avail. Nothing came to his mind.
The only thing he knew for sure was that he had died right there.
Along with his squadron. Otherwise he would not be here right now.
But then..
Why was he unable to remember his death?
Snip! Snip!
Suddenly, snippets of memories ran through his head at once, causing him to collapse back in his rucksack.
"Yo Mika, you good?" Mikhail heard Icarus, but he couldn’t focus on him right now.
Taking a deep breath, he looked up at Modric.
"I’m fine, just a bad dream."
He felt Modric’s eyes pause over him for a second before he nodded.
"Hope it wasn’t too bad. In any case, your presence is requested at the ground for the morning drills."
Mikhail nodded.
"I’ll be there, you two go ahead."
As Modric and Icarus were about to leave, Mikhail called them out.
"Wait."
The duo turned, confused.
"What’s the date today?"
Icarus’ eyes widened while Modric’s eyebrows raised a little.
"I think he might have hit his head somewhere while-"
Modric interrupted him, paying him no heed.
"It’s Tuesday, April 9th of the year 2093 today, Mika."
Mikhail’s eyes momentarily widened but he quickly composed himself and nodded.
"Thanks, you can go now, I’ll be there in a few minutes."
Modric nodded, stepping out the door while dragging Icarus with him.
As soon as the duo left, Mikhail stood up instantly, panicked like a rat.
"Fuck, fuck, fuck," He started cursing.
His eyes darted around the room, landing on a mirror by the wall.
It wasn’t that large, even having a few cracks on it.
But it was enough for him to see his face and body.
And as he walked over, his reflection made a chilling realization run down his spine.
Mikhail knew what had happened.
He had regressed back in time after dying.
Of course, he couldn’t remember the exact time or day from when he had died.
But if he had to make an estimate on the last thing he could remember, he had regressed back by 7 years.
A drop of sweat beaded down his head in the cold.
It did not make sense to him.
’Why me? Why only me?’
Why not his squadron?
But it was then that a possibility came to his mind.
Looking in the mirror, his hand quickly went to the bandages wrapped around his neck, starting to loosen them up.
Within a minute, he was done, the bandages falling to the ground.
His fingers pressed against a part of the neck where a symbol was etched.
Or was supposed to be as it had changed now, proving his fears true,
Right above his collarbone, the crook where his shoulder and neck connected..
Was a tattoo.
A tattoo of an inverted rosemary cross.
As his eyes landed on it, the mark shone in a bright crimson color, burning against his neck.
His eyes twitched at the sudden pain but they didn’t leave sight of the mark.
Mikhail was left stunned.
"What the-"
’It wasn’t supposed to be like this.’
It wasn’t supposed to be inverted. It should’ve been straight.
It was a mark that people would die to get their hands on.
The mark, including Mikhail, was a rarity that only 8 people in the world possessed.
It was called a Rosaryth.
But after his regression, it had changed now.
The mark was inverted, something that wasn’t supposed to happen.
Mikhail wanted to curse again.
More and more mysteries were piling up and he couldn’t make sense of a single one.
As he was about to pick up his bandages, a head-splitting pain assaulted his head.
Collapsing to the ground in pain, Mikahil felt like tearing his skin off as he squirmed.
The following second, his body convulsed, his hand automatically shooting to his mouth.
"Blergh!"
Mikhail felt something wet dripping down his hand as it came out his mouth.
Opening his eyes, he was shockingly greeted by a sight of fresh crimson.
Blood.
The fresh taste of iron registered in his mouth as he looked at the crimson-stained bandages.
Before he could make sense of it, something more shocking took place.
[Regression Assimilation Complete!]
[Oath Complete!]
Suddenly, a window popped up in front of him.
—————〔Oath XXX〕—————
•
Condition: *$@*#@((@$&
[Penalty]
•
Death
———————————————
[Low Character Progression!]
[Unable to display conditions of Oath XXX]
’What!?’
His brain was unable to catch up with so many holographic screens in front of his eyes.
It was too much information.
The man had just landed in his world for fuck’s sake.
Unfortunately, the worst for Mikhail was still yet to come.
As the next window...
—————〔Chronicle I〕—————
•
Condition: Uncover the assassination and save your academy from getting destroyed.
[Rewards:]
•
Character Progression: +15%
•
Mana Increase: +300
———————————————
Made his face turn ghost white.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Decision To Make
chapters.content:
Chapter 2: Decision To Make
Mikhail was in utter confusion at the holographic screens in front of him.
Especially for someone like him, who was seeing them for the first time.
’Oath and a...Chronicle??’
He understood the meaning of the first one but not the second one.
From what he could see it seemed like a mission that he had to complete.
’Uncover the assassination? Save the academy?’
What the hell did it mean by this?
The [Rewards] seemed to be the things he would be given for completing it.
Asides from whatever assassination it meant, how could he even trust these screens?
His head was in confusion.
He had never seen any holographic power like this in his past life.
It wasn’t even his Dragma so what?
And then, the oath screen?
What oath? He couldn’t remember making any.
’Hmm..’
Mikhail calmed his mind and closed his eyes.
Clank!
His eyes suddenly opened with a sharp motion.
It was true, he did have an oath in his body.
But the main problem was.....
The fact that he didn’t know what the conditions were, or what he had taken for swearing it.
He didn’t feel any power up in his body.
’What the hell?’
The only clue he had was the penalty. Not like it was a good one anyway.
"Death."
The word reminded him of his fate in his previous life, sending a shiver down his spine.
No. He couldn’t squander this chance again.
From knowing the oath was true, he knew at least the screens weren’t lying.
Which meant the rewards were true as well, and also most likely the mission.
Currently, the mission was the only clue to his oath too as the screens were probably connected.
Mikhail turned his eye to the mission screen.
He tried to remember anything remotely related to the assassination or destruction of the academy around the current date.
’Urgh..’
His whole memory was a haze after the regression.
But then...
Click!
It clicked inside his mind.
The Dominique’s visit soon to the academy in his previous life.
They were high figures in the empire that were known to do whatever the hell they wanted.
They often visited the wall for their own purposes or whatever the hell pleased their mind.
Anything but the state of the wall or the world outside of it.
Why would they care about them?
Mikhail gritted his teeth.
In any case, he remembered the truth now.
The Dominique’s visit that day and the sudden raid of wormholes north of the wall.
It was all related somehow, instead of an accident as it was labelled in his past life.
Which meant that it was orchestrated.
By someone inside the academy or the Dominique themself.
And it was Mikhail’s job to find out who was responsible for it, if he wanted to find anything related to his regression.
Mikhail looked at his guns and clothes on the table beside him.
He had been through many serious and life threatening situations in his previous life.
But nothing as important as this.
Life wasn’t guaranteed for him this time unlike the last time in the horrifying incident.
The timeline was changed now.
But if he didn’t do anything, the oath would kill him.
And his family.
Mikhail remained silent for a second before taking a deep sigh and standing up.
Grabbing his guns and putting on his clothes, he moved outside.
Well, it wasn’t like he had a choice in this.
***
Stepping outside of his room, Mikhail felt the cold seep into his skin.
The sudden breath of fresh air brought a sense of refreshness to him.
It felt good, it felt comforting.
"Not for long though."
He shifted his mind back to the days that awaited him.
But before he could think forward, a voice interrupted him from the side.
"Not for long what?"
It was instantly recognizable.
Mikhail turned, his aqua-colored eyes making contact with the amber gold ones of Modric.
He quickly excused.
"I was talking about the refreshness after a good sleep, it won’t be there after the drill after all."
Modric stared at his face for a second in silence, as if contemplating his words.
Or maybe something deeper, Mikhail didn’t know.
The man was always a quiet one.
He saw Modric nod in the next second.
"You’re right. You need to hurry up, everyone is already there except you."
Mikhail didn’t say anything else, just moved forward.
Modric, as if it was natural, came to his right hand side behind him and started walking with him.
It was his place as the vice-commander.
Walking through the camp brought a fresh line of memories to Mikhail.
Bad but nostalgic memories.
Even if this was the place that changed him for all the years before he became a true soldier, it still held his memories.
The creaking of the nether wood under his feet and the buildings standing tall aside him.
It was where he had spent a major part of his life.
Ignoring the architecture, he focused his gaze forward.
To the central space of the camp.
He saw most of the squadrons already assembled there, as Modric had told him.
On the bridge overlooking the central space, he saw the 4 masters of the encampment and the Lord Commander.
He saw two of the figures directing intense stares at him but he was used to it.
Ignoring them, his gaze met with the Lord Commander’s grey eyes.
The message was clear.
’Don’t do this again.’
Mikhail nodded, turning to the squadrons below who all looked up at him as well.
Again, a majority of furious stares were directed at him but he remained unfazed.
Walking down the stairs, he joined his own squadron.
Going to stand up at the front, he greeted all of them with a slight nod.
Words could be exchanged later, it had already gotten past the debrief time.
And as said the moment Mikhail stepped up to the front, the Lord Commander Vlahovic tapped his stick to the ground.
"We shall start the drill debriefing now."
’It’s time.’

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Ironhold and Routes
chapters.content:
Chapter 3: Ironhold and Routes
A/N: A bit of an information dump, please bear with me.
____
As Vlahovic ended his debriefing, Mikhail turned around to his squadron.
For a ’squadron’, there were only 5 people including him.
It wasn’t much but it was the most you could get on the Ironhold.
It was a place where people from all over the Empire landed up.
You couldn’t say they were nice people however.
From bastards abandoned by their families, to thieves and rapists sent here as a punishment.
You could find all kinds of moral alignments on the Ironhold.
It was one of the reasons every person was a male here.
As for the reason Mikhail was brought here, he couldn’t quite remember.
He and the ones in his squadron were among the oldest people here at the camp.
They had been brought here as kids so naturally none of them remembered.
Turning back to Modric, Mikhail extended his hand.
Without a word said between them, the former understood the command immediately.
He withdrew a map from the back of his uniform and handed it to Mikhail.
"Thanks."
Opening the map, Mikhail saw a very detailed but hand-drawn map of the Ironhold and the world beyond.
The Ironhold was a wall that extended hundreds of meters into the sky and spread as wide as a hundred kilometers.
It was what separated them from the world beyond, the world of Sylaris.
Disgusting creatures that fed on dead bodies of humans.
In his previous life, he and his squadron had died by their hands, north of the hold.
He didn’t know where however.
Looking at the map, he saw a majority of the area above the hold unmapped.
It was because nobody had dared to explore the whole world beyond them.
Nobody knew what was in the far north.
However, a minor part was drawn in a detailed format with lines extending from a black point on the wall.
The black point was their camp and the lines were the scouting routes they had to check every morning.
Keeping these routes cleared and checked allowed them to steer clear of any Sylaris nearby the hold.
In case they were to attack, the camp would be prepared.
The wall was there to hold them back but it wasn’t enough to just let them keep there.
They needed to be killed.
Fortunately, the Sylaris almost never attacked the wall. They were too disunited among themselves.
Regardless, as soldiers of the Camp Nether, it was their duty to keep guard of the wall.
Looking at the routes, Mikhail only had 3 routes left for the taking.
The others had already been picked.
This didn’t happen before. It was the first time because they had gotten late.
Otherwise, their routes were always the same.
Examining the 3 routes, Mikhail tried to connect them to anything that could help him in his mission.
It was then that one of the routes clicked to him.
’Wait, wasn’t this...’
He remembered.
It was where one of the riders had gone missing.
Deaths were common on the hold, especially during scouting so no one really took it that seriously.
But for Mikhail at that time, it had always been suspicious.
It was because of the areas surrounding the death of the man.
’Hmmm...’
He stared at his squadron before taking a deep sigh.
Turning to them, he pointed two fingers at two of the routes.
"Modric and Oscar, you two will take this route. Yvan and Icarus, you both will go on this route."
The team looked over, seeing their routes. They already knew that the last route would be Mikhail’s.
There was no need to question why he was going alone. All of them had a sense of trust between them.
"Why do I get the shortest route again?" Icarus whined, forming his mouth into a pout.
"You always ask this and you always know the answer, you are too erratic to be let out for too long."
Modric answered before Mikhail could.
Everyone knew the past experiences with Icarus, his curiosity had often got them into perilous situations.
"It’s why I pair Yvan with you, he can keep a good eye on you." Mikhail continued with a nod.
Yvan, the tallest of their group, nodded quietly.
He was the younger brother of Modric, having his meadow green hair but different colored eyes.
Both of them were known to be quiet-natured.
"Tsk." Icarus clicked his tongue, not complaining anymore.
Yvan tapped him on the back, pouring more salt on his wounds.
"Let’s move on, you knew this would never work anyways."
Icarus’ expression got worse but he didn’t complain. He knew the guy was right.
Turning back to Modric, Mikhail continued.
"Be careful, the routes are new. We don’t know anything about that area."
Modric gave him a simple nod in his reaction.
"Understood."
Turning to leave, Mikhail had just taken a step before Modric called him out as well.
"You should be careful as well." He stared into Mikhail’s eyes.
For some reason, Mikhail always felt as if the green-haired boy’s eyes knew more than what they showed.
It wasn’t his concern though.
Nodding, Mikhail went on his way to the stables.
***
Arriving at the stables, Mikhail was quick to arrive near his horse.
Most of the people had already left so there wasn’t much of a commotion or rush.
Greeting a stable hand, Mikhail petted his abyssal-black horse.
It had grown alongside him and there was a strong bond between the two.
He even had a name for it, in an area when men mostly didn’t give one because they were common to die.
Sora.
It meant sky or so Icarus had told him. A word he had learned from his time holed up in the library.
He said that its fur looked like the clear night sky.
Strapping up his things, Mikhail was quick to climb on and grab the reins.
Pulling them, he rushed to the only gate in the middle of the encampment.
The two gatekeepers had it pulled up there for them to quickly leave.
Getting to the front, he saw the gatekeeper attach a device to his leg.
It was one of the academy’s ways to ensure you didn’t explore farther than what you were designated.
Although nobody did, the punishment was already hefty enough.
Furthermore, it was also made to know of deserters or traitors as it kept track of your location.
As the guard took note of his leaving time–something which was done to reward soldiers who got done early– Mikhail noticed something strange.
He wasn’t the usual one at the gate.
In fact...
Looking to his right and the tunnel in front of him, none were the same as well.
It was normal for 2 guards to be replaced, but not the whole batch of 8.
"I haven’t seen you before." Mikhail initiated the conversation.
The guard looked up from his notepad, with a brown weird and a strange smile.
It gave Mikhail the ick for some reason but he chose to ignore it.
"Just got appointed last night per the Watch Guard commander’s orders."
Mikhail contemplated for a second before asking again.
"Temporary replacement or permanent?"
"Permanent."
Mikhail felt something strange gnawing at his back.
"Then where are the other-"
"Oi! Would you hurry up, bastard!?"
Turning around, Mikhail saw a squadron of 6 waiting for him to get done already.
"Yeah, hurry up fucker!" Another joined in.
Giving them no mind, Mikhail turned to the front where the guard spoke first now.
"You are ready to go."
’Hmm...’
As he was going to snap his reins again, Mikhail turned back to the man.
"What’s your name?"
The guard hesitated for a second before replying with the same smile.
"Rubert."
Mikhail was quick to reply.
"No, last name."
The guard shook his head, implying that he didn’t have one.
The suspicion in Mikhail was at an all-time high but he had to leave.
But he chose not to show it.
"Alright, thanks. Nice to meet you Rubert."
The guard nodded.
"Same here."
With that, Mikhail snapped his reins and sped off into the tunnel that led outside the Ironhold.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: The Investigation By The Lake
chapters.content:
Chapter 4: The Investigation By The Lake
***
Mikhail climbed off his horse, binding it to a safestall.
There were multiple of them installed in the forest beyond the wall by scouts who came before.
Taking a deep breath, Mikhail rubbed his gloved hands.
The cold had gotten significantly worse north of the hold. He couldn’t even feel his face.
Stepping through the thick snow and the tall thin trees, Mikhail felt an eerie feeling on his back.
He knew he was on the right path.
The main reason he had picked this route to investigate wasn’t just the man’s death.
It was also because what was near the area he died.
A frozen lake. But not just any lake.
It was a mana source.
A mana source were natural sources or artificial objects that contained large amounts of condensed mana.
Oftentimes, these sources were a big reason for a wormhole’s appearance.
A source this close to the wall had to be monitored every day. One wormhole and it would prove to be very dangerous for them.
The Empire overestimated the strength of the people at Ironhold.
Most of them didn’t know anything about fighting, even if you were to ignore their dwindling numbers.
In fact, a majority of the recruits that arrived didn’t even opt to be soldiers, they ended up choosing to become a steward or a weaponsmith etc.
The fear of death was too strong for some people.
Moving back to the topic, mana sources were sensitive things.
Any kind of disruption or damage could result in the two realities interconnecting, allowing Sylaris to break through.
Unfortunately enough for the man, he came right next to a mana source.
The Magnolia Lake.
It wasn’t a large lake by any means but it was certainly larger than your average mana source.
There were definitely signs of trouble.
But here was where Mikhail begged to differ.
Even though the reports stated in the past life that his death might be related to the mana source, he felt it was masked.
If it was due to a mana source, then a gate would have opened, which would have gotten everyone to know.
Not to mention, in the first place, a mana disruption was quite a rare case by itself.
So someone had definitely covered it up.
Unfortunately, Mikhail didn’t care enough in his past life to think about this.
Focusing himself forward, he quickly started running.
He couldn’t stay idle, monsters were also known to assemble near a mana source for healing.
Fortunately, he had every bit of the map memorized over the years.
But the moment he took a few steps, an ear piercing scream echoed in his ears.
"AAHHHHHH!!!"
By instinct, Mikhail’s hands went to his guns as he quickly took cover.
He quickly examined the area around him for any danger.
Seeing nothing, he quietly jumped from tree to tree, searching for the source of the scream.
’Yes this definitely leads to the lake.’
It only proved his point more.
As he took the next step however, the sound of a gunshot echoed awfully close to him.
Boom!
Remaining calm, Mikhail quickly pressed his back to a tree, hiding himself.
He heard the gunshot connect perfectly with the target’s flesh as they crashed on the ground.
He could hear their whispers and whimpers as they crawled on the ground.
They were near. Awfully close.
Mikhail readied himself for a confrontation, pressing his hands to the triggers of the guns.
The time window was too small to activate a spell, he couldn’t take the risk.
But to his confusion, the footsteps suddenly faded away from his hearing.
’Hmm?’
He didn’t let his guard down just yet. It could be that they had already seen him.
Illusion spells could interfere with his senses.
It was only after a couple of minutes of hearing nothing, that he decided to move.
However, the moment he turned his neck to see behind the tree, he felt a cold blade press against it.
Click.
"Move and you’re dead."
The voice came from right behind his ear, no higher than a whisper.
But it wasn’t the chasers.
Rather, from how the voice sounded at the verge of death, it was the target.
He probably didn’t recognize Mikhail because of his fading eyesight as he approached death.
He wasn’t worried, the man was on the verge of death. He could do nothing.
"I think you should be worried about yourself, that gun will blast your heart faster than this blade can snap off my neck."
The gun pressed deeper into the person’s heart.
The man laughed hoarsely, minutes away from death now.
"You sound pretty conf-"
Boom!
Blood and flesh flew in the air as Mikhail moved his gun to his thighs in a split moment.
The man screamed but he paid him no heed.
Grabbing his wrist, he spun the man in the air, throwing him away.
Standing up, he wiped the blood off his gun and face.
"Who said you’re safe while speaking?"
Disarming the blade from him, Mikhail bent him on his back and stood above him.
The man had one of his legs blown off, he could do nothing.
He screamed but it was so light that the birds in the nearby trees remained unbothered.
Grabbing his hair, Mikhail pulled the man’s head up, making him meet his eyes head on.
It was then that the man recognized him in his dying moments.
"Wait...wait..wai-I-"
"Yes yes, I know you. Stop wasting your breath on me, you’re dead."
The man’s voice turned hopeless, realizing his fate.
Mikhail had no time for his antics however.
"Those people, who were they?"
The man looked him in the eyes, hesitating if he should even tell when Mikhail was leaving him to die.
The latter was quick to remind him of his oath however.
"Remember your oath, you don’t want to be remembered as a traitor, do you?"
For the first time, the man suddenly shivered. Mikhail knew he was a man of his word.
Coward but would still hold up his oath.
Unfortunately, he needed to speak quick and stop wasting Mikhail’s time.
The scream might have not reached those men’s ears but the boom of the gun could possibly be enough.
He needed to get the intel and go back.
Mikhail couldn’t go to the lake. He didn’t know how many people would be there.
It was a huge risk by himself. At max, he could take on only 4 or 5 people considering his rank.
Fortunately, the man finally spoke up.
"S-s-s...Pact....k-killed....b-b-betrayal...protect....the D-Dominique."
But before he could continue, the light faded from his eyes and he slumped in Mikhail’s arms.
The latter clicked his tongue, it was barely enough of a clue.
Unfortunately, he couldn’t do anything else now. He needed to hurry back.
Mikhail gazed at the dead body in front of him.
As a brother in arm, it was his duty to bring his body back for a proper burial.
Unfortunately, Mikhail wasn’t as patriotic as him.
Strapping his guns, he quickly rushed back to his horse.
And back to the Ironhold.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Visit To The Library
chapters.content:
Chapter 5: Visit To The Library
***
Arriving back at the hold, Mikhail checked in with the guards.
He was still a little suspicious of them but he had no time.
After informing them that there was nothing out of the ordinary except some monsters, he was allowed to go.
They removed the tracker and he took his horse back to the stables.
As he parked it, he was relieved to see his squadron’s horses at their places too.
All had gone well. At least for now.
Taking his stuff, Mikhail reported to the mess hall where he saw his friends already seated.
Modric was the first to notice his arrival.
"Back safe and sound?"
Mikhail nodded.
"All the same. What about you all?"
Icarus was the first to voice up.
"Yeah it was all the same, there was no need for pairs at all."
It was obvious that the red-eyed boy was still mad about his pairing.
Nothing could be done about it though.
Yvan shaked his head, sighing.
"I sensed some mana disturbances but nothing major, don’t worry."
"Alright."
A word of response was a compliment enough for all of them.
They looked at him waiting to join but Mikhail waved his hand.
"I need to report to Lord Vlahovic about today, I’ll eat later."
"Well okay, we’ll be training in the grounds if you need us later." Oscar replied.
"I understand."
Giving his final words, Mikhail left the mess hall to his own quarters.
’I can’t let them get involved in this.’
The words of the messenger were still ingrained in his mind.
This was definitely not a normal killing.
’How did they even enter the camp’s vicinity undetected?’
From what he knew, there were radars to notify about any potential intruder within a certain radius.
Verified personnel were of course let go. And with the tracker acting like a verification device, they were safe too.
The trackers self-destruct when removed without a special method so there was no chance of using them.
’Is someone a traitor from the inside?’
"S-s-s...Pact....k-killed....b-b-betrayal...protect....the Dominique."
His mission told him to prevent the assassination and the man had told him to protect the Dominique.
They were definitely related somehow.
Protect them from the people that were chasing him?
Probably. Or at least he was 90% sure.
Because he was still not sure if it were the people who were chasing the man or the monsters in his previous life.
There was also that vision he had seen in the morning in bed.
Another reason was the first word that the man spoke.
’Pact.’
A pact, as in a treaty or promise?
S- pact.
Two words, pact was the second word. So it must have been some kind of special pact.
S was the starting letter of the first word.
Mikhail thought long and hard but couldn’t find any clue.
There was only one solution to this current problem.
The academy library.
Fortunately, he knew how to read unlike many people here in the camp.
It was all thanks to Yvan, the book worm between them.
In fact, in this current situation, Mikhail would first go to him for help but as he had said earlier, he didn’t want to involve his squadron in this.
The library wasn’t that big or useful but it was his only hope.
To make sure the master would give him access to advanced books too though, he had to go somewhere else first.
Vlahovic Ibrynt.
The word from the Lord Commander of the camp would definitely allow him every bit of access he needed.
Packing his stuff, Mikhail wrote the exact words of the man down before going outside.
To Vlahovic’s Quarters.
***
[After 2 Hours]
Mikhail arrived in front of the library, the woodsteps creaking under his feet.
He looked at the normal slip of paper in his hand.
It had nothing written on it, just a blank short piece of paper that you could find anywhere.
That was what it would appear to any normal guy.
Because it wasn’t normal. It had Vlahovic’s mana signature on it.
An invincible signature that would instantly be understood by the master in the library.
It was a temporary referral card. One-time use.
Mana signatures were something very unique to the person so it was almost impossible to replicate them.
Up here on the hold, they were the easiest and the best way of secret identification of a person.
Heading up the stairs, Mikhail opened the wooden door to a narrow hallway.
Immediately, he was made aware of the silence inside the library.
It wasn’t because of the rules, even though it was a rule to keep the silence.
Barely anyone came here for books, except those nerds or time passers.
Most of them didn’t know how to read, and those that did barely had interest in reading words.
They were past rapists, not librarians.
Heading further inside, Mikhail saw the hallway spread into an expansive space covered in bookshelves.
"Oh, Mikhail?"
Surprised by the noise, Mikhail flipped to his right where he saw a man so thin, he could trace his bones popping out of his skin.
A small black patch of fading hair on his head and blue frosty eyes that could close at any moment, the master stared at Mikhail.
He was Master Vance de Loras.
One of the 4 Masters under the Lord Commander Vlahovic.
He was responsible for everything administrative and knowledge related in the camp.
Basically the brain. He was rumored to be above 100 years old but none dared to ask the man.
As powerless as he was said to be though, Mikhail was always on his tips near him.
Something about the man’s presence put him on an edge. Something that none could see.
He could never sense him at all.
"Greetings, Master Vance. I’m here for a visit to the library." Mikhail maintained his calm.
An eerie smile spread on Vance’s face, the same one he always used.
"Ahh, a rarity for you. But of course everyone is welcome here to seek knowledge. Go ahead."
Mikhail nodded, not wanting to spend much time wasting words on him.
He handed him the blank piece of paper without any words.
Vance held it from his hands, examining it in his hands for a second as he adjusted his monocle.
"Very well, you can access the back shelves as well. If you have any problem or require help in finding any book, feel free to call me out."
The man smiled, throwing the piece of paper in the fire beside him.
"Thank you, Master Vance."

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Relevations
chapters.content:
Chapter 6: Relevations
***
It had been an hour since Mikhail had started searching.
And so far he couldn’t find a single clue of any pact or treaty related with wormholes.
Anything with the Ironhold, or the Dominiques. Nothing.
Mikhail took a deep breath, trying to calm himself down.
The man whom he had faced back there. He wasn’t strong by any means.
In fact, in a straight on fight it wouldn’t take Mikhail more than a minute to send him packing.
So Mikhail doubted he could have made it far to the lake without being caught by those people first.
In that case, there was a very minute chance of him having overheard this S- pact thing.
It wasn’t information he found out from them.
It was something he already knew, and with how illiterate these people at the wall are, it had to be something commonly known.
Something famous that he would know from seeing those people.
’What could it be..what could it be..?’
"S-pact, S-pact...S-pact..." Mikhail gritted his teeth.
"Are you troubled, Mikhail?"
Mikhail’s head snapped to the side, where he saw Master Vance peeking from a bookshelf.
In his plan of getting to his answer quickly, Mikhail chose to at least seek some help.
"Master Vance, do you know of any treaty or pact that starts with S? Any famous treaty, maybe related to this Ironhold?"
The old man’s face caught surprise for a second, probably for a second.
Mikhail didn’t fear him much. He did give him a weird vibe but it wasn’t one of danger or distrust.
In fact, he was a good man, always wishing the best for everyone on the hold.
Not every man sent to the wall was rightfully sent. The system of law in the Empire wasn’t perfect.
Perhaps it was the worst there could be.
There were many people on the hold unfairly sent because they were chosen to be the scapegoat for someone’s crimes.
Mikhail knew Master Vance was one of them.
Besides, the man was already pushing death. There wasn’t much he needed to be careful of.
"A pact or treaty starting with..
hmm..
S? A famous one too...I can’t say there are many that relate to what you need, Mikhail."
Frustration was seen on the black-haired boy’s for a second.
But he quickly masked it.
What if?
A realization struck his hard.
Of course, the man couldn’t have known about a pact or treaty when seeing those people.
What if it was something else? What if it were the people?
What if...
S- Pact, wasn’t a treaty or pact. But an organization?
Mikhail turned to Master Vance, in perhaps his last hope of the situation.
"Master Vance, what if it was an organization or group? Something that’s named S-pac-"
Mikhail was interrupted by a tap of the stick on the hard wood by Vance.
He saw his blue calm eyes lock with his, a confirmed expression on his face.
As if he knew what he meant now.
"You’re talking about Silent Pact, that’s the only answer to your description."
Mikhail’s eyes widened, and Vance knew he had been right.
***
Mikhail stepped out of the library, everything making sense in his head now.
Silent Pact.
A famous organization, even later in his previous life.
It all clicked up.
What they were famous for...
’Famous for exploitation of mana sources and wormholes for the use of destruction and resource hoarding.’
A single part echoed inside his mind from the sentence.
’Mana sources and wormholes.’
And they had been near a mana source just this morning.
Magnolia Lake.
There was no need to wonder what they were up to.
He knew about it.
Forced Wormholes.
As the name suggested, these were wormholes forcefully opened by people.
Oftentimes, it was done for training or hunting, however, it was also a method exploited by people for evil as well.
Using mana sources to artificially create monster raids was one of the uncommon methods.
A reason for this was because it took multiple days to set a single wormhole up.
Most of the times, people would just get discovered before they could stage it.
Which was supposed to be the case here as well.
The group wasn’t even supposed to get close to the mana source without getting discovered.
It made no sense how they avoided it.
There was a very minor chance for someone to betray the academy but it was definitely a possibility.
Especially from outside as the guards kept record of everything.
In any case, what it definitely confirmed to Mikhail was that they weren’t a normal group.
Just a normal forced wormhole required a lot of resources to open and operate.
But from the incident in his past life, there were multiple ones.
Not only that but to infiltrate the academy security system was no joke.
However, a point was still unclear to him.
It was their motive with this attack.
No matter how many forced wormholes they orchestrated, trying to execute a Dominique with it was plain stupid.
A Dominique was a force to be rivaled with.
Even they probably knew that this would not assassinate a Dominique.
It didn’t happen in his previous life too so why do it?
They were literally a one person army that you do not want to trifle with.
A couple of wormholes were barely enough to stop them.
Mikhail could confirm this with definite surety after the incident in his past life.
Nobody would think of it as an assassination plot where the chances of the target were less than even 10%.
Unfortunately, he needed to figure this out. It still confused him.
He could only have any chance of solving it after the incident though. It was useless right now.
In any case, most of the information he needed was in his hands now.
He knew the people, the targets, the time and how they would do it.
Now he just needed to prepare for the fateful day and when it would come, he’d be ready.
This time for sure, he’d pass the mission and finally find out more about himself.
Closing his thoughts, he quickly made his way back to the messing hall to eat before joining his squadron.

chapters.title: Chapter 7: Battle Request
chapters.content:
Chapter 7: Battle Request
***
As Mikhail was exiting the messing halls, he saw a familiar figure in front of him.
His grey eyes were already staring at him, as if waiting for him for quite a while.
"Lord Commander." Mikhail nodded, paying his respects to Vlahovic.
He knew that he had been outside but didn’t show it.
It was no wonder the chatter had died down.
Vlahovic nodded, accepting Mikhail’s greeting.
"Mikhail, you are needed by Master Avalon in his quarters right now."
Mikhail tried to hide the annoyance in his face.
He was expecting this but it would have been better if they hadn’t linked him at all.
’Well, nothing I can do.’
"Oh, what for?" He asked, feigning ignorance.
"A squadron leader was found dead on a route nearby yours. His body was totally torn by monst-"
"Huh?" Mikhail was unable to hide his surprise, causing Vlahovic to raise an eyebrow.
Masking his emotions, he quickly excused himself from the suspicion.
"I was taken aback by the news of someone’s death by monsters. The ones I heard were quickly taken care of by me."
"Oh. Well, it is unfortunate and all the while suspicious that we weren’t able to sense it quickly enough."
Mikhail nodded but inside he was just as confused.
’Monster marks? There is no way they thought of those marks on the man’s body as a monster’s marks.’
Either the camp was too dumb or the Silent Pact had forced monsters to attack the man’s body to cover their own marks.
It was probably that.
Unfortunately, if they did that then they would have definitely found Mikhail’s involvement too.
It wasn’t a problem but it made his work more tougher as the group would now be more careful with their operations.
"You are our only clue to what happened so I hope you’ll cooperate. Taking aside your issues with Avalon." Vlahovic looked him in the eye.
Matching his stare, Mikhail sighed.
"It’s fine, it’s his issues with me, not me with him," Mikhail shrugged.
He was right.
The Master of Security, Avalon, also among the two masters that were glaring at him in the morning, had unnecessary issues with him.
Whenever Mikhail used to perform well in training or defeat his guards, the man punished him.
Unfortunately, the black-haired boy could only suffer as he was a Master.
Fortunately, he was mostly safe from his major threats because of Vlahovic.
"That’s all." Vlahovic tapped his stick, disappearing into thin air.
’Well, here we go.’
Mikhail prepared himself for a tiring interrogation session.
***
[After 2 Days]
Mikhail stood in the castle’s central ground, with his squadmates.
His eyes swept around the area as his friends trained in front of him.
He wasn’t just preparing himself with his training, he was still trying to figure out the traitor from the academy.
’Who could it be?’
For the past 2 days, everything had just died down. No suspicious behavior or anything.
It was as if now they were just waiting for the main event.
In better terms, only 6 days.
Looking at how slacked these people were, Mikhail wished he could all force them to train all day.
This was going to be their cause of death in the coming battle.
They were men of the hold, people who were supposed to protect this damn wall.
Yet, you had people looking fatter than the royal pigs here.
As he was about to turn back to his teammates, Mikhail was tapped on his shoulder from behind.
Turning, he saw a group of 5 people behind him.
Just from a glance, he could tell they were strong but their faces told a different type of strength.
Paid strength.
Mikhail looked up above on the bridge overlooking the castle grounds, ignoring the five.
There he was.
With curly black hair with a touch of gray at their tips now and a scrawny face that was screaming displeasure.
Master Avalon, staring right back at him.
These five worked under him and probably came to him to try and interfere as always.
"What do you want?" Mikhail asked, getting straight to the point.
"You must be the punk right, the one who’s always on Vlahovic’s dickroll," The man neared him.
Mikhail could smell alcohol off of him, he was drunk. He smelled like he hadn’t taken a bath in a week.
Usually, words like what he had just said about some higher up would get you executed but not on the Ironhold.
Vlahovic knew about it and didn’t mind it too. He knew these weren’t civilized people to begin with.
As for why he said it, it was known to everyone that Vlahovic favored Mikhail.
They said it was because of his strength but Mikhail himself didn’t know.
The man had been looking after him since he had come here as a kid.
"Ay, are ya deaf you asshole?" The man tried to push him back.
Unfortunately for him, Mikhail was quick to react, holding his arm in place.
One of Avalon’s common tactics. To try and provoke them back into attacking.
Afraid that it was too easily seen by all of them now.
"I don’t think your words relate to what I asked you first. You can either answer me or leave," He answered calmly, letting his hand go.
The man sneered with rage.
"Shut up bastard, I don’t take orders from you. If ya aren’t afraid, why not take me to the sword ay? Ya afraid?" He roared, attracting the attention of even others now.
Mikhail sighed, already knowing where this was going.
Unfortunately, he wasn’t falling for the bait as always.
"No-"
"Why are you refusing Mikhail? Is the strongest squadron commander afraid to take on a mere nobody now?"
A familiar but annoying voice interrupted Mikhail from his rejection.
Looking up, he saw those dirty brown eyes looking back at him.
Again though, this wasn’t going to convince him.
His squadron didn’t even bother to look. They already knew this was normal for him.
He was a day 1 target for Avalon.
As Mikhail was about to reject them again though, a sudden idea struck his mind.
From every day since he had regressed back here, he had been training.
But not once had he been tested in a real battle like his past life. The man from before barely even counted.
He needed some real challenge, where he could test his [Essentia].
And what better way than to experiment on the pig in front of him.
Avalon’s goons were always trying to kill him anyways, so what better option could he have?
And so, he grabbed the steel sword next to him, ignoring the training wooden ones.
He threw it to the man, surprising even Avalon along with everyone in the process.
"Alright, I guess I can take you on for a good beating."

chapters.title: Chapter 8: Oaths
chapters.content:
Chapter 8: Oaths
Mikhail stood in the castle central grounds with the man–who was named Burnip–in front of him.
The area had been cleared for their fight with all of them waiting at the edge, full of suspense.
Normally, fights were common whether just spars or actual fights.
Nobody really cared, all of them were barbarians.
But this time was different. Because it was Mikhail.
Mikhail who had accepted a fight willingly into Avalon’s trap.
Everyone knew how much Avalon hated Mikhail, it was knowledge as common as knowing he was Vlahovic’s favorite boy.
But not in their wildest thoughts had they predicted this future.
Even his own squadron were staring at him with surprise, trying to figure the reason behind his decision.
They wouldn’t though.
Mikhail started at Burnip and the ordinary longsword on his hand.
For fairness, he himself had been handed two ordinary handguns.
He wouldn’t be needing them though.
He had enough of using his weapon these days. Now it was time to test up his magic.
As he was thinking though, suddenly a holographic screen opened in front of him.
—————〔Essentia〕—————
•
[Otharis]
﹂ ꝏ
•
[Aqualis]
﹂ Herald
•
[Cindralis]
﹂ Monarch
•
[Norvalis]
﹂ Monarch
——————————————
’Oh nice.’
The screen was nice but the information inside wasn’t anything new to him.
In this world, selective people were blessed with magic as well, their name being Maguses.
Or Magus for a singular user.
Magical energy, or mana for easy term usage, was present all around them, even in the body of maguses.
But this mana when broken down had natural elements to it, resulting in six partitions.
The 6 elements. Cindralis (Fire), Aqualis (Water), Borealis (Air), Gaialis (Earth), Norvalis (Darkness), Divalis (Light).
The more elements you were blessed with at your birth, the more talented you were.
The rarest possibility was having 3 elements and yet Mikhail was one of those people.
As for why he wasn’t a talent in the Empire, he didn’t know and he didn’t care.
For the names written below the elements, they were his [Limiters].
A Magus had 5 ranks they could try to reach in their life, with each rank getting progressively harder.
Magus, Warden, Herald, Monarch and Archon.
Your [Limiter] for an element was basically the level at which you could use spells for your element.
A Cindralis-Magus with a Herald Limiter could never use a Monarch Cindralis spell without serious consequences.
It was hard for them to even rank themselves past their element’s limiter anyway.
It was a complicated case if you were a multi-essentia magus though.
Unfortunately, Mikhail had no time to get into the complexities right now.
Focusing in front of him, he prepared himself for the fight.
Reaching out in his pocket, he took out 2 bullets, loading each in his guns.
Burnip’s expression turned visibly frustrated, thinking he was not taking him seriously.
But Mikhail was quick to clarify.
"I’m just saving my bullets, they are harder to get here on the hold."
It was true.
It was also why Mikhail planned to finish this guy off with just 2 of his spells.
Getting to their positions, Mikhail saw the battle begin.
An announcer wasn’t needed on the battles here.
Shouts went off from behind Burnip, cheering him on.
"Attack this pussy!"
"He ain’t even a slash’s work!"
It only seemed to work in Mikhail’s favor though.
He saw the man’s confidence increase as they circled each other, prompting him to dive in for a slash.
Mikhail, however, knew it was faint to force him to attack.
Even that blockhead was smart enough to know he had no chance with Mikhail in close range.
Those guns would blow a hole in his arms or legs.
Which was why...
SLASH!
A clean whip cut through the air as Burnip’s sword slashed.
It was all too simple for Mikhail as he stepped outside to dodge it.
But he knew it wasn’t over yet.
"Borealis Ballium," Burnip pushed his palm from underneath, straight at Mikhail.
The latter remained calm, his eyes tracing all of Burnip’s movements.
In a moment, Mikhail’s arms were crossed, defending himself from the sharp push of wind in the next second.
It tore into his arm sleeves a little but again, he was harmless.
Instead, Mikhail saw Burnip take more advantage of the push by putting more distance between them.
The latter was trying to force Mikhail into using his only two bullets in a moment of hurry.
With his element of wind though, the pipsqueak would be able to dodge them quickly enough.
Once missed, Mikhail had no weapon to defend himself with.
Unfortunately for Burnip, the blue-eyed boy had already tested what he wanted to see.
’I overestimated. This guy is weak.’
If all of them in the camp were like him, then it was no wonder a lot of them died back then.
In a sense, he didn’t even blame the deaths. These slackheads needed a lesson of where they were.
But for now, he needed to give a lesson to one in front of him first.
For the first time since the battle started, Mikhail’s hand went to his guns
In this world, there were 6 elements.
But there was a 7th element too.
Click. Click.
Mikhail loaded both his guns, his eyes locked on Burnip.
The latter was now standing at the edge of the area, waiting for his chance to dodge and hide among people.
He knew now not to make any moves.
It was all for when Mikhail would shoot. And in his mind, miss from such a distance.
And that 7th element was...
The element of Oaths, Otharis.
However, there was another special quality about this element.
Mikhail raised his guns, taking aim at Burnip.
It was that this element was only exclusive to Mikhail in this world.
Only him and no one else.
"In the name of God of Oaths, I will hereby not move from my position throughout the whole battle," He whispered.
Mikhail felt it, the same feeling from his past life in his chest. The feeling of similarity. The feeling of chains binding him inside.
"As a compensation for the said condition, the shooting range for my guns in both magical and non-magical spells will be doubled."
He felt it. The chains binding closer and closer. Only one step was left now.
Looking at Burnip’s expression, Mikhail was once again reminded of something from his past life.
A thing that people often failed to realize while facing him.
And it was that out of all the elements he possessed...
"This oath has been signed under the name of God of Oaths and I, the Oathkeeper, shall abide by it," he whispered.
His element of Oaths was the strongest one.
Boom! Boom!

chapters.title: Chapter 9: Dragmas
chapters.content:
Chapter 9: Dragmas
Mikhail put his guns inside as two pieces of steel flew high in the air.
In the next moment, he saw the man hit the ground on his knees, his eyes widened.
It was as if he had just seen his life flash before his eyes.
And he had. The bullets had missed by a millimeter from hitting his legs or more accurately, his private parts.
He also knew that Mikhail had intentionally waved off his gun at the last second.
He knew he had lost. Lost too, in a second of him retaliating back.
There was no kind of spirit left in Burnip to reply back.
And the same was for everyone watching, as they were left amazed by how Mikhail even aimed so accurately.
The guns he was given were so basic and badly manufactured that it would take you years to control its recoil.
Yet, he did it so effortlessly.
Mikhail, however, wasn’t there to entertain them. He was staring at his pale hand instead.
As the fight came to an end, the oath was lifted from his body.
And at the same time, a deep tiredness settled in his body. He knew it was because of the oath’s toll on his body.
It was still too weak. Not like his past life, where he could have handled multiple oaths on his body.
Mikhail clicked his tongue in frustration.
"Tsk."
Ignoring his thoughts, he looked above where Avalon had already disappeared from the bridge.
And so had his goons as well, taking Burnip along with them.
With nothing left to wonder now, everyone got back to their training.
Even his own squadron, who knew this would happen anyways.
’I need to get stronger.’
Mikhail clenched his hand.
"Spar with me, Modric." He called out.
***
"Umbralis Phase."
Modric’s leg cleanly phased through Mikhail as it turned into a wisp of black smoke.
Turning his own momentum on him, the latter grabbed his leg and spun him through the air.
Slamming him on the ground, Mikhail called an end to their battle.
"You take too much time with your calculations. Put too much trust in something that can go wrong." Mikhail extended his hand to Modric.
"Yeah, I know," Modric replied, taking his hand to stand up.
"When the battle gets faster, you need to trust your instincts more. Sometimes, they are more useful than all those scenarios in your head."
Mikhail strapped his guns to their holsters.
Modric nodded, understanding his advice.
"Remember, if battles could be won by knowledge or numberly predictions, those Emperors would be scholars instead of ruthless bastards." Mikhail looked him in the eye.
"I get it. It’s just that your elements and Dragma are hard to deal with."
Mikhail tapped his shoulder several times, encouraging him.
"It’s fine, just try to find your way around it. Everything has a weakness, even the hardest of walls."
He could understand Modric’s frustration though.
Aside from just his elements, the main reason Mikhail was mainly a pain for his opponents was his Dragma.
A Dragma was an ability granted to a person from their birth.
It could range from being the most useless to having the potential to even cause mass-scale destruction.
They were so unique that they were almost never the same between two people.
And that was all Mikhail knew about them.
There was much more knowledge but up here, there wasn’t much you could know.
Fortunately for Mikhail, his Dragma was one of the most unique you could find out there.
It was the ability to form spells without doing incantation for the nodes.
He still needed to form the nodes but he was cut out from doing the work of saying the names.
That was his Dragma, called Flawlëss.
For example, taking a basic spell such as Aqualis Ballium, for the first node where he needed to define the element.
Rather than saying "Aqualis" out loud, he can do it with a hand symbol.
Doing so, obviously uses more mana but it shortens spell times for him by a large amount.
This gave him a whole new edge in a battle, often taking his opponents by surprise.
It was why most of the people refused to reveal their Dragma.
A good Dragma could change the tide of the battle within a second, like the one Mikhail had.
Dragmas were tied to a person’s soul tree.
So as the person grew in ranks, their Dragmas would evolve too.
It was ingrained into them.
Done with training, Mikhail turned to Modric.
"Training is finished, you all can go do whatever you want now."
Before he could go, he was questioned back.
"Where are you going?"
"Just some work, I’ll be back soon," Mikhail instantly replied back.
But as he was walking, he was again halted in his tracks.
"Mika," Modric called out.
It was the name that he said.
It was their personal nicknames that they had given to each other when they were kids.
So Mikhail knew it was a personal call out.
"Yeah Mord?" Mikhail answered back, dropping the formalities too.
"You good? You seem a bit off lately."
Mikhail was surprised but quickly masked it.
He would be a fool to think he’d escape Modric’s eye.
Unfortunately, he could still say nothing.
"Yeah don’t worry, just been a little stressed and busy because of the incoming visit. I’m fine."
Mikhail assured with a light smile, looking back into Modric’s golden eyes that were boring to him.
For a few seconds, there was silence between them before Modric nodded.
"Alright, just remember to take care of yourself. That’s the biggest part."
Mikhail smiled and nodded.
"You too."
As their conversation ended, Mikhail turned and got on his way again.
’I’m sorry but I can’t let the same fate happen again. Not to you guys.’
The Dominique was about to arrive, and he needed to be prepared.
***
It was finally time.
Today was the day. The day Mikhail had been preparing for since the day he arrived in this world.
The arrival of the Dominique.
And the attack on the camp.

chapters.title: Chapter 10: Dominiques
chapters.content:
Chapter 10: Dominiques
Today was the day.
Getting up early, Mikhail dressed up and headed outside.
Assembling the squadron, he was the first to reach the drill grounds.
Various thoughts ran through his head as he saw the other squadrons report on the ground.
The routine for today was not going to be how it was any other normal day.
There were going to be no drills, even though they had all assembled in the grounds.
Rather, it was to welcome the Dominique who would be here in no less than an hour now.
"Nervous?" Mikhail turned to ask the squadron.
All of them shook their heads except Icarus.
"I guess a little. It’s not everyday that someone this big comes to visit us."
Mikhail focused his gaze on him, making him shiver a little.
"It’s not that I’m scared. It just feels a little odd to be this strict."
He nodded, turning back forward.
"I can understand. But you shouldn’t think of it as something too big. As I always say, they are just Dominiques, not our gods."
"Uh huh." Icarus nodded, straightening up as well.
This was what Mikhail always tried to keep separate from his squadron and others.
No matter how high they were from them, he never thought of them as gods.
Their pride had just carried them too high.
And the people here today would witness it clearly.
There was no way to stop what had happened in his previous life. It was clear.
He wasn’t able to figure out who the culprit was even after all those efforts.
And even if he somehow could, he had no confirmation of their strength.
But what he could do now was at least minimize the casualties.
From his previous life, the Dominique coming today would most likely be Celine Strathorne.
If he remembered correctly, she was the newly appointed Dominique La Borealis.
She would also be the youngest Dominique in the current council.
A Dominique was a person only second-in power to the Emperor himself.
In total, there were 6 Kingdoms under the Empire, making them 7 in total.
Each of the 6 Kingdoms represented one of the Essentia, with a Holy Church governing over each of the Kingdom.
All of the Kingdoms served under the Emperor and remained loyal to him.
The ruler of each of the respective kingdoms was the leader of their respective holy churches representing the elements.
Also called the Dominique of that element.
These Dominiques, however, were not appointed by the Emperor or by the Church.
They were appointed by the Gods above through a mark of a cross called the Rosaryth.
Whoever was blessed with the Rosaryth after the death of the previous Dominique would be their successor.
It did not matter whether they were a peasant or a royal or a bastard or anyone.
Even the age or gender did not matter. Under the gods, everything was a law and a rule.
Going against it would be against the very rules set by their ancestors of the Church and the Empire.
However, a Rosaryth wasn’t only just a mark of position. It was also a mark of power.
Because a person blessed with a Rosaryth, had no Limiter for that respective element.
The power they could unlock with their element was then endless. There would never be a ceiling for its growth.
And it was the same reason why Mikhail’s Otharis had no Limiter.
Because he had a Rosaryth.
And he was also a Dominique, one not known by the Empire.
One whose element had no Church or Kingdom.
He was Dominique La Otharis.
In any case, going back to the original topic, Celine would arrive in an hour or or less.
Again, there was no known reason for why she was coming.
Maybe it was just her interest in the world as a newly welcomed Dominique.
Or maybe she had an alternative purpose.
Nobody knew.
Maybe she was just here to kill some people and show her power as a newly appointed Dominique.
She was young after all, one could have such wants.
And the Empire couldn’t care less about it anyways.
After all, they thought of the people outside the walls as nothing more than filth to be thrown out.
Unfortunately, these people here were yet to realize the harsh reality of the truth.
They presumed that just because she was young, she was going to take mercy on them.
It was all wrong for them though. Celine Strathorne was anything but naive.
No.
Mikhail still remembered that look she had on her face that day.
"Okay! Everyone, Assemble Up!" Vlahovic shouted from the middle of the grounds.
Everyone focused their attention on him.
"We have been going through this every year, so I don’t think I need to explain what will happen!"
He looked at everyone for confirmation and everyone nodded.
"Good! Just get through this day as always and everything will go back to normal."
"Yes Commander!" A loud voice of agreement came from the squadrons.
The visit routine wasn’t all that complex.
The Dominique would arrive at the camp.
They would inspect the camp. If they chose, they could also interact with the squadron leaders.
They would also check the drill routes outside of the academy to see how well the camp maintained the area.
These were the main things that made the visit so important.
In the first place, Mikhail didn’t understand why Celine had informed them of a formal visit.
Usually, even if they wanted to come, Dominiques would come and go whenever they wanted or pleased them.
It was their world and most of them preferred it like that to not let their moves be known by the world.
But since it was a formal visit, there was a need for a proper visiting routine too.
Usually, it wouldn’t take long as the Dominique would want to get out of the place as early as possible.
But if anything went wrong, they could do anything and the Empire wouldn’t object to it.
To the government, Dominiques were their golden childs.
A couple of lives or some destruction was nothing compared to their worth.
They would go to any length to spoil them.
Mikhail was suddenly woken up from his thoughts by a shout.
A shout that marked the beginning of it all.

chapters.title: Chapter 11: The Gate
chapters.content:
Chapter 11: The Gate
"THE DOMINIQUE HAS ARRIVED! PARADE, STAND IN ATTENTION!"
The single line was enough for everyone to be brought back to reality as everyone’s feet moved in synchronization.
THUMP!
Everyone stood in attention as complete silence overtook the grounds.
Not a single sound or movement was let out as Vlahovic turned towards the entrance of the castle grounds.
Their position made it so that the entrance was right in front of Mikhail’s eyes.
And it was from there that he saw it.
As clear as if it all had happened yesterday.
Tap. Tap. Tap.
The sound of heels tapping against the stone pathway echoed in his ears.
And she entered his view, looking just how she did on that day.
With natural grace and poise, she entered into the ground.
Wearing the black and red military outfit that hugged her slender body, the golden ampulets displayed her status as a Dominique.
Her blonde hair neatly fell down her face in an asymmetrical bob, almost framing her emerald green eyes.
Celine Strathorne.
Everything about her was calculated, as if she wasted no movement or energy.
A sharp wind blew through the area, lasting no longer than a moment.
And in that single moment, it was as if her eyes had swept through the whole area.
’Insane.’
Even standing this far, Mikhail could feel the passive pressure weighing down on him.
Even the air felt as if it was much thicker than before.
Celine turned to Vlahovic, who performed a proper salute before handing over the report for drills.
The whole ground stayed silent as she checked the reports in the distance.
Within a minute, she was done.
She turned over to the grounds next, walking over after handing back the papers.
At this point, Mikhail had already felt some people looking at her with awe and admiration.
And it disgusted him to the core.
’A few more minutes. That’s all you people will need.’
Reaching the middle of the ground, Celine straightened herself, making sure everyone’s attention was on her.
And then for a minute, she just stood there in silence along with everyone else.
And when it finally felt like some people were getting impatient, she opened her mouth.
"Filth."
Her soft and monotone voice resounded in everyone’s voice as clear as the wind.
’Resonance Magic.’
Mikhail figured out.
Before everyone could get confused on what she meant, Celine continued.
"That’s what you all are."
And a wave of silence hit the arena the next instant. Nobody had expected her to start her speech with that.
Mikhail immediately felt a few people stirring.
’This is just the start.’
"Nothing more than a useless pile of filth. Filth, unnecessary to be kept in the Empire’s clean walls."
Sounds of fists clenching could be heard in the crowd now.
Yet, despite all that, not a single person could dare to break the silence.
"Your birth inside those walls was already sufficient enough of a taint that throwing you here should feel like a blessing to you people."
At this point, except Mikhail’s squadron, signs of rage could be seen everywhere.
Even Vlahovic had a look of shock on his face as if he couldn’t understand what happened.
It was well known that all Dominiques hated the Morvians.
But in the history of visits, there was not a single time where they bothered to give a speech on their hate.
Celine, who could very well see what was happening, still continued.
"You are nothing more than a pile of rotten slaves. Your existence does not remain past the point of serving us to our use."
A chilling wind blew through the area, sending shivers crawling through everyone’s back.
Mikhail could feel the rage reaching the boiling point for everyone.
But he also knew that Celine knew that very well.
’Huh?’
Mikhail felt as if for a split moment, someone had been staring at his back.
Unfortunately, he was given no time to think as Celine delivered the final nail to the coffin.
"Even the monsters behind those wormholes have more worth than you pathetic junks."
Yet, before the crowd could rage, the ground shook with a large rumble.
RUMBLE! BOOOOM!
It was followed right after by an ear-deafening explosion at the gate.
Immediately, confusion and disarray spread through the area.
People struggled to maintain their balance and focus as screams erupted in the area.
’It has started.’
Mikhail, remaining calm along with his squadron, slightly turned his head back to them.
"Keep them close. Let me see what’s happening," he told Modric, who gave an understanding nod.
Footsteps were heard as a man came running into the ground to Vlahovic.
He was fully bathed in blood.
Blood that kept pouring out of the gash on his right side, which was armless now.
Everyone turned silent as the guard reached Vlahovic, their horrified gazes fixed on him now.
"What happened!?" Vlahovic shouted, asking to get any hold of the panicking situation.
But the words that would come out of the guard’s mouth next would be the words that would haunt people’s minds for years to come.
"A barrage of wormholes...
pant...
all of them Warden rank or below...
pant..
and.."
A wave of horror swept through everyone as the reality set in.
"And what!!?" Vlahovic gripped his shoulders and shouted, already fearing what was to come next.
If there was anything amidst this incident that Mikhail still remembered exactly on point from his past life....
It would be the next words echoing in the grounds from the guard.
"The gate. It was left opened."
SLICE!
A head flew in the air, blood splattering all over the ground and Vlahovic.

chapters.title: Chapter 12: Response To The Attack
chapters.content:
Chapter 12: Response To The Attack
As the guard’s head flew in the air, blood splattered in the air.
It fell down on Vlahovic and the others, covering their shocked and horrified faces.
THUMP! THUMP!
From behind the trees, a humongous figure appeared into view.
The ground shook with every step it took.
Blood dripped down from its sharp canines and claws as its ferocious golden eyes darted left and right for the next prey.
Shrouded in horror, every man was unable to move under the pressure of the giant feline monster.
The only ones who still remained in their senses were Vlahovic, Celine and...
Mikhail and his squadron.
He observed everything happening with a calm expression.
And it was the same for the ones behind him, who had experienced much worse than this along with him.
However, as said, it was not the same for everyone.
"Don’t you dare move bastards."
Vlahovic cursed the men, still remaining under the beast’s eye.
Unfortunately, some of the weaker hearted men were too scared for their lives.
Those stewards were seeing Sylaris for the first time.
Not being able to take the pressure anymore, one finally made the run.
"I can’t!! Save me!"
"No!!" Vlahovic screamed as he quickly sprung in front of the sylari to hold him off.
But something even he didn’t expect was another sylari to jump out from the trees.
With the body of a half-mantis and half-tiger, it was smaller but much faster.
Mikhail watched Vlahovic try to counter and reach the second beast with a spell but..
’He won’t be able to make it.’
Which left only one person who could reach him fast enough.
Everyone’s eyes instinctively moved to Celine at the last moment, expecting some help.
These empirical bastards might hate them but they were still to their use right?
She was definitely not just going to let them die here. Not the whole camp.
’Wrong.’
They all froze when they saw the expression on her face.
’The same expression she had on the last time.’
There it was.
One of pure and absolute disregard of their lives.
As if she had no concern of what was happening in front of her.
It was at this moment that every man in the camp realized.
They fucked up.
The Dominiques or Empire had nothing to do with their lives or well-being.
Their existence was comparable to that of a simple paper.
Weak and feeble with no importance whatsoever to them.
In that split second, it felt as if the time had frozen for everyone. Like it was truly the end for most of them.
But then...
Click. Cluck. BOOM!
An ear-deafening boom resounded from the corner, as something tore through the air.
CRUNCH!
Within the next second, the nearing head of the monster was torn off its body, exploding into a thousand tiny pieces.
Every man looked in shock at the monster’s lifeless body lying on the ground.
It was only when their senses started to return that they followed the trajectory of the shot.
Their eyes landed straight to a young man in the distance.
There was no sign of distress on his face as he stood there with a gun in his hand.
His eyes were as calm as the blue sea they embodied.
Lowering his gun, Mikhail noticed Celine spare an interested glance to him from the side.
’I have no time to entertain their bullshit plans.’
Unfortunately, because of her, he also couldn’t use his oath powers.
It was a well known fact that Dominiques could sense other Dominique’s power within a certain distance.
It was one of the methods they used to identify the new Dominique.
Mikhail didn’t know if it was the same for his element. However, he couldn’t take risks.
He had to make do with his other elements.
Feeling that everyone’s eye was on him now, Mikhail knew this was the right moment.
Stepping forward, he reloaded his guns.
Click. Clank.
"Listen closely because I’ll not repeat again. This isn’t the first time you people are facing such threats, so stop crying and screaming."
Even most of the stewards here came from getting their lives in bad situations and then getting caught for it.
Mikhail turned back to Modric, giving him the gesture.
The latter nodded, and turned back to convey his order to the men.
"You have faced such beasts outside, you can face them if they come inside. Don’t act as if you are going to die."
Mikhail raised his gun again.
"Cindralic Morphis."
BOOM!
The bullet passed straight through the crowd, blowing the head of another monster.
Its headless body fell down the bridge from where it was trying to sneak through.
The men who just witnessed what happened were left in complete awe now at his precision.
But Mikhail quickly brought them to their senses.
"There’s no difference between you fighting them outside or inside. So grab your weapons and start fighting if you don’t want to die."
From the side, Mikhail saw Vlahovic arrive as well.
The humongous monster he was fighting at the side was now completely torn to shreds.
"Mikhail is right. This isn’t your first time and it never will be."
He cleaned the blood off his sword.
"This is how life outside the walls is, you will need to fight and survive against such unexpected situations."
Everyone visibly suppressed a gulp and nodded, now mustering up their courage and confidence.
"According to the information, it’s a multiple wormhole breach. Let’s hope there aren’t many to handle."
Vlahovic ran a look around the area.
"You bastards." he gestured to the stewards and smiths.
"Stop acting like you’ve never swung a thing in your life. Take whatever there is and get to fucking fighting before I blow your heads myself."
Silence. Ruthless Vlahovic was one of the very rare sides that they ever got to see.
And of course, they knew the price for raising their voice against that.
"There’s too many monsters. The moment they get inside, we are all going to die and help from other camps will arrive too slow."
Mikhail nodded.
The man was right.
There were 15 camps lined up along the wall. Even though theirs was the biggest, help from others was going to take a while to arrive.
So they needed to hold up or the place they lived in would get destroyed in a matter of minutes.
"Our first objective is closing the gate and clearing any monsters that have gotten inside. Only then we can move above the walls and attack them from above."
Vlahovic affirmed his statement.
He then turned to Mikhail.
"Take however many people you want with you Mikhail and close that fucking gate down. I’ll go up and assess the situation. You are the leader down below."
The words were also his order to everyone else in the area.
It was clear that people had objections but currently their lives held more importance to them.
And Mikhail had clearly shown his abilities so they naturally felt safe around him.
Checking up on everything, Vlahovic turned back to the men he had with him.
"Time is short. The more we delay it, the more destruction we will face. Spread out to different parts of the camps and clear the area of beasts."
Not a single complaint was heard. Everyone agreed with what the old man said.
He clearly knew better than them.
As everyone started spreading out, Mikhail was called out by Vlahovic.
"I’m leaving the attack to you, make sure to return my trust back in full." he cracked him a proud smile.
Mikhail’s brows raised his surprise.
He had been waiting to ask this to the old man.
How had he given the gates and charge of the men to him so easily?
Even if that was what Mikhail wanted to ask of the old man.
Understanding his surprise, the old man spoke up.
"This attack, you already knew something about it didn’t you?" He asked.
Mikhail’s eyes widened with surprise.
"No wonder you were acting so off these days. Don’t worry, it’s not that I think you are the main cause behind this."
He put a hand on Mikhail’s shoulder to calm the young man down.
"Far from it. I’m sending you there because I think you know the real people behind this."
Mikhail was taken aback momentarily.
’How did he even-’
He saw the old man let out a slight laugh.
"My bones might be old young man, but not my brain. You know how to stop this don’t you?"
For a moment, Mikhail was left speechless by how much he knew.
But returning to his senses, he nodded.
"I do."
Vlahovic smiled, tapping his shoulder.
"Then get going lad. I’m counting on you to end this before my bones run out of rum."
Mikhail bit his lip but nodded slowly.
"Yeah...I got it."
Vlahovic gave a light ruffle on the head before turning to leave.
’Crazy old man.’
Turning, Mikhail quickly ran to his group.
Initially, his plan was to ditch them to run towards the gates but now, it was much easier.
He was just going to take the whole platoon there.
’I’m grateful. Lord Commander.’

chapters.title: Chapter 13: Retaliating Back
chapters.content:
Chapter 13: Retaliating Back
Advancing through the thick trees, Mikhail’s eyes darted to the left and right.
Being surrounded by such a thick environment reduced their range of attack and visibility.
So feline monsters had it easy to sneak up on them.
Without stopping, Mikhail turned his head and ran an eye over the people.
’42.’
That was the amount of people he had with him.
For the danger level of the gates, that was certainly low.
However, it was fine as Mikhail alone would be the one dealing with the main problem.
Unfortunately, there was one big problem.
Mikhail’s eyes went to the corner of the sky where he could see a woman flying above them.
’Why is she here rather than with Vlahovic?’
Celine Strathorne had decided to follow Mikhail’s plan instead of Vlahovic.
For whatever reason, he could not know with that straight expression of hers.
Mikhail resisted clicking his tongue.
’I can’t use my Dragma now.’
Before, he could at least hide from the members but as a Dominique, Mikhail had no doubt that she would see it.
Not like something would happen with her seeing it.
But for Mikhail it was one of the major surprise cards he had over opponents.
’Whatever.’
He turned to the front, opening his mouth for the first time after running.
"All the tankers and shielders come to the front. The rest, slow down your pace and give them space."
Having led parties of this size in the past, Mikhail knew exactly what to do.
He wasn’t new to this.
