Trusting him from before, the platoon moved according to his commands.
"Form a wall at the front. I want the larger ones standing with even spaces in the row with the smaller ones between them. Keep your shields at the ready."
He could hear some mixed opinions coming from the crowd but they still listened.
’These are the best positions. Walking among the trees, our weakest positions are the corners and sides.’
This was why he placed the larger guys there.
"Next up, the archers and scouts. Place yourselves between the places of the large tankers with your bows stretched out and your arrows nocked."
Finally, the formation started to make a little sense to them.
Heeding his command, the archers and scouts also came at the front, fitting between the spaces.
"Gun shooters stand behind the large guys, use the shields and their bodies to your advantage to hide and shoot."
Coming to stand in the middle as well, Mikhail completed the second row.
"The remaining melee attackers in the middle. Save your energy for the main battle at the gates. However, keep watching the sides for the monsters there."
Mikhail saw them suppress a gulp. But at least they agreed.
"Switch from time to time to rest and conserve your energy. Don’t tire yourself before we even reach there."
Reloading his guns, he gave all of them a cold stare.
To remind them of the reality, the situation they were in.
"Once again, this isn’t a drill. This is fight-or-death, just a taste of what would happen after you get out of here. Don’t over exert yourself for your ego, only to lose your life."
Mikhail turned to the front after finishing his words.
The second he did, he heard movements between the tree branches.
His body wasted no time.
"Shields!"
Immediately, the corner shielders raised their shields at his order.
THUD! THUD!
The very next second, contact was made with the shields. The monsters growled in pain at the sudden interference.
"Archers and shooters!"
Seizing the moment, the ready archers and shooters immediately sprung to action.
As soon as the shields were let down, the arrows and bullets tore through the monsters.
It didn’t even take a second for them to die, their lifeless bodies falling on the ground.
Cheers of happiness and awe were let out from the platoon as they realized how effective it was.
Their trust and respect for Mikhail increased even more now.
However, Mikhail knew not to celebrate this early.
Raising both of his guns in different directions, he spoke up.
"Cindralic Morphis. Aqualic Morphis."
BOOM! BOOM!
The very next moment, two high speed bullets shot out from him to the front.
One was enveloped in a trail of fire while the other had a torrent of water surrounding it.
PLUNGE! PLUNGE!
Two large wolf heads flew in the air from the front as the bullets made impact.
Blood and pieces of flesh flew through the air as their lifeless bodies fell down, silencing the crowd.
Mikhail was the first to break the silence.
"Stop letting your guard down and celebrating as if’ we’ve already won. You are just asking to be attacked again."
Click. Click. Cluck. Cluck.
"I’ll handle the monsters after you shoot and reload or any large monsters incapable to be stopped by the shields."
Mikhail turned to the front again.
"Now let’s move. We are short on time."
The party, who understood their mistake now, nodded.
"Understood!"
And they started running again.
***
[After 5 Minutes]
Mikhail could finally see the gates in sight, as the trees came to an end.
"Prepare yourselves. After we’re out of the trees and buildings, we will have no cover to ourselves."
Reloading his guns again, Mikhail turned to the shielders.
"Prepare yourselves. You will need to face the first brunt of the attack. It’s going to be hard."
Fortunately, after killing so many monsters, the shielders were brimming with confidence.
"We understand!"
"Good. Get through this and celebrate all you want."
As his last words trailed off, Mikhail’s party finally came out of the trees.
’This is the moment. Where at least 150 people lost their lives last time.’
The Gates Of the Massacre, as the academy would later come to call them.
And as he gazed ahead now, he was reminded of his previous life again.
Mikhail could hear the people behind him already lose hope within a second.
Horrified gasps escaped their mouths.
Right where the gate was supposed to be first was now an army of monsters.
If Mikhail had to estimate, at least 60 already.
And more coming out of the forest outside the gate.
’Madness.’
It was the only word that came to Mikhail’s mind as he gazed at the Sylaris that were running towards them now.
Last time, he had been in another location so Mikhail was able to survive this atrocity.
But not this time.
Fortunately, he was not without a plan as well.
There was only one option.
Pointing his guns, Mikhail could already feel the people behind looking as if he had gone insane.
"No don’t-" He heard someone beg him from behind.
"Cindralic Morphis. Aqualis Morphis."
BOOM! BOOM!
Two heads and a million growls escaped into the air.
_______________

chapters.title: Chapter 14: Reaching the Holes
chapters.content:
Chapter 14: Reaching the Holes
’Now’s the time.’
Utilizing the chaos to his advantage, Mikhail broke free from his group formation.
However, he still didn’t plan to just let them die.
There still needed to be someone to lead them.
And his eyes went straight to a person in his row.
"I got something to take care of. I’ll trust you to take the lead Van." He tapped his shoulder.
Yvan was taken aback by his sudden action and words.
Mikhail was planning to leave these people just now?
It would have left any other person confused and disarrayed.
But Yvan calmed him self, thinking upon his words. He had just called him ’Van.’
Within the squadron, everyone had nicknames for each other as a kid.
It was normal for them to talk using those when they were alone. However, if there was one person that used them the least it was Mikhail.
It didn’t mean that he didn’t love them. In fact, he was the most caring one out of all of them.
They looked up to him as an older brother. It was just that he had difficulty expressing his emotions.
In the rare cases that he did use the nicknames though, the family knew that they couldn’t deny or argue against his orders.
Because it was a personal request from a family member to a family member rather than as a squadron commander to a subordinate.
And within the family, no one ever denied to help each other.
Which was why he was instantly willing to take on what he said.
He trusted Mikhail enough that whatever he was going to do was probably more important than facing an army of monsters.
"I understand," he nodded.
Mikhail gave him a light smile to express his gratitude.
"Thanks."
As soon as he turned to leave, he called him out again.
"But be careful out there. In whatever you are doing, Mika."
Stopping for a second, Mikhail turned back and gave him a nod.
"I will," he said before speeding off.
***
There were two ways to stop a wormhole produced from a mana source.
One, the most obvious one, was to just defeat the monsters that came outside of it.
Or two, to destroy the object that was ruining the mana frequencies at the mana source.
The object could be anything. An artifact, a person, or even a phenomenon.
The point was to just balance out the mana disturbances.
However, it didn’t come without high risks either.
When balancing out the disturbances and frequencies, one had to be extra careful.
One misstep or loss of control could cause them to go haywire, making a disaster even worse than before.
The wormholes would either explode or even more would open up in addition to the current ones.
Which was definitely something Mikhail couldn’t afford.
7 gates were already enough of a disaster as it was before.
The men of the hold could never handle more or even an explosion.
7 large-scale explosions would completely destroy the mana source and atmosphere there.
And this would result in an even higher rate of wormhole openings in the future.
’I can’t mess this up.’
Moving forward through the clouds of dust, Mikhail was left with nowhere to run when a horde of beasts jumped towards him.
’I’m sure she can’t see me through the dust.’
While he knew about Celine’s ability to observe everything through the air, he was pretty sure it wasn’t the same for dust or anything else.
Though he could be wrong. It wasn’t anything more than a hunch.
Regardless, there was no choice right now.
Raising one hand in the air, he joined his two fingers with his thumb before bending them, forming a sign.
"Cindralis."
The first node for element.
Then he closed the two fingers, performing another sign with his last three fingers.
"Fumivex."
The second node for the state of the spell.
"Spinora."
Third node for its shape or motion.
And he was done.
"Cindralic Hurrialis."
The instant he completed the spell, the complex circuit diagram in front of him lit ablaze in a crimson glow.
All the nodes connected with each other, completing the spell.
WHIRL!
The very next moment, a vermillion hot tornado formed around Mikhail, mixing with the dust clouds.
The sharp hot winds tore through the scales of the nearing monsters, throwing them in the air.
Taking both his guns out, Mikhail wasted no time shooting.
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
It took no longer than a second, as five big holes ruptured through the now defenseless monsters.
Mikhail, however, took no notice. He had already started moving forward.
THUD! THUD! THUD! THUD!
Click. Click. Cluck. Cluck.
The lifeless bodies fell on the ground, halting the charge of other monsters as well.
Fortunately, Mikhail had already moved ahead.
***
After half an hour of relentless killing and dodging, Mikhail was finally able to exit the camp gate.
The gate was in full chaos now.
The screams and growls could still be heard from behind but due to the large clouds of dust, he couldn’t see anything.
’Just hold strong Yvan.’
Peering ahead into the forest, Mikhail estimated the distance he had left.
The straight route from the gate took him at least 20 minutes last time.
The 20 minutes were also done on a horse, so it would definitely take him longer on foot.
’I can’t go the straight route.’
The monsters were charging straight from the wormholes to the gates.
So going this way would inevitably place him right in the center of their assault.
’It’s longer but I’ll have to take the roundabout.’
Which prolonged the time even more.
A window appeared in front of him, which he had gotten used to seeing in his past few days.
It displayed the amount of mana he had left in points.
—————————
• Mana: 4100/6400 [Dragma]
—————————
He had already wasted a lot of mana and yet, he wasn’t even at the main fight.
’There’s no choice.’
Reaching there faster required him to use more spells.
"Cindralic Bormis"
The next instant, a trail of blazing fire shot out from his hands, propelling him into the trees.
***
[15 Minutes Later]
The trail of blaze finally died down from Mikhail’s arms, landing him safely on the tree.
He was not so far from the wormholes now.
RUMBLE! RUMBLE! RUMBLE!
He could hear the monsters charging in hordes from afar.
’There’s definitely a summoner or tamer in them.’
It was the only way they could direct the monsters toward one direction.
From here, he had to proceed with more caution.
His mana was already down to 3400.
"Huff...Huff.." Mikhail could feel the tiredness from fighting too much already catching up to him.
’Damn it with this body.’
Compared to his past life, it was weak both physically and spiritually.
’My condition doesn’t help as well.’
Ignoring the tiredness, Mikhail jumped to the next tree silently.
And finally, he could see his destination in the distance.
7 gigantic wormholes, right by the lake’s shore.
And right next to them were...
’Impossible.’
Mikhail’s eyes widened.
It wasn’t just a group of 3 to 5 people. No.
There were much more.
_________________

chapters.title: Chapter 15: Making Sacrifices
chapters.content:
Chapter 15: Making Sacrifices
’At least 16 people.’
Mikhail assessed the dire situation with a calm expression.
As difficult and impossible the current scenario was, he didn’t feel any fear or nervousness coursing through him.
His body? Maybe. But his soul and mind? No.
Maybe it was the effect of the battles in his previous life.
In any case, the problem had turned out to be much bigger than expected.
There were at least 16 people in front of him around and behind the wormholes.
All of them were dressed in oversized black robes with golden runic patterns embroidered on them.
Their arms and faces were both covered so he couldn’t even see who was controlling the monster’s charge.
Much less their faces.
’It’s going to be impossible for me to handle them all at once if they are equal to my strength or a little less.’
The only slim hope he could see was if they were all Magus-ranked.
But that was pretty much impossible.
’If they were, they wouldn’t be able to control all these monsters.’
Their control over the monsters was impeccable. To the point that not a single one dared to even attack them.
As soon as they got out, they charged straight to the gate.
’This is a little problematic.’
As much as he wanted to kill them right here, Mikhail knew that it was impossible.
It wasn’t the main goal anyways.
The first goal he had to achieve was to close the gates.
There were two ways to balance out the mana frequencies and close a gate.
One, obviously, was to eliminate the people or sources that were disturbing them in the first place.
Or second, was to balance out the mana disturbances with your own mana frequencies.
The second one was basically a myth.
The reason for that was that it was almost nearly impossible to do it besides a few rare instances in history where people were able to do it.
To explain, every attack that a magus did basically had a mana frequency to it.
The frequency behind that attack was determined by at least a thousand factors in the attack.
Speed, shape, density etc.
So to intentionally shape out an attack to match the mana disturbance frequency was almost unheard of.
You needed extreme mana control to be able to do that. And an insane amount of precision.
A slight miss could cost him big time.
The number of gates would contribute to the difficulty in any other case, but not here.
It was because all the gates had been produced by a single source.
So all of them were operating at the same level.
All Mikhail had to do was balance out the frequencies for a sufficient time until the gates would successfully shrink and shut down.
Of course it was easier said than done.
There was only one way for him to balance out the frequencies of his attacks to the wormholes.
It was to make an oath.
An oath with a Dominique present right in the area.
He didn’t know if Celine would sense it from that far in the battlefield.
He didn’t even know if she could sense Otharis.
But currently, it was his best chance to get done with this matter besides fighting them.
’The problem is..’
Mikhail would need to make a high sacrifice and consequence to be able to tune his attacks down or up to match the holes.
The sacrifice in an oath was the condition you made for the oath.
It could be giving up something temporarily, an objective or anything.
And the consequence was of course the penalty for failing the oath.
One of the main differences between the two was the comparison.
The consequence always had to be greater than the reward.
’There’s no other choice.’
He could only hope that Celine wouldn’t sense it.
Mikhail raised his hands.
"In the name of God Of Oaths, I solemnly swear to not move out of range from the foes during the whole battle, remaining locked to the restricted area."
Just like always, he felt the chains start to bind in his heart.
"As a compensation, all my mana attacks or spells shall be tuned to the specific frequency of the wormholes even if the disturbance level changes."
The chains almost covered his heart when,
As he feared...
TUCK!
The chains suddenly halted, not moving forward.
’As I thought, the sacrifice isn’t enough.’
He needed to sacrifice something more.
"As an additional sacrifice, I swear to not use my Aqualis element during the whole battle while limiting my Norvalis spells to Magus rank only."
’Yes.’
He felt the chains moving again.
CLINK!
’Finally.’
It worked.
Now the final phrase.
"This oath has been signed under the name of God Of Oaths, and I, as the Oathkeeper, shall abide by it."
Mikhail felt the chains connect together in his heart, sealing the oath.
It was complete.
Now for the moment of truth.
Mikhail remained in his position for a few seconds, holding his breath.
If what he feared was true, then any second, she would arrive at his location.
Thump. Thump. Thump. Thump.
Mikhail could even hear his faint heartbeat in the tense silence, despite the loud charge of monsters in the distance.
It was as if all sound had died out for him in the moment.
A few seconds passed by.
’Surprising.’
Fortunately, there was no change whatsoever.
’Seems she didn’t sense it from that far.’
Or it could be something else.
Currently however, he had no time to think about that.
He had already wasted 2 minutes.
Taking a deep breath to calm himself down and balance himself, Mikhail raised one of his guns.
It was already loaded.
The distance from the trees to the group in the distance was certainly far.
But Mikhail took his aim to the nearest one.
It would still be impossible for the average shooter but Mikhail had been using guns as a kid.
Especially the ones strapped to his waist.
The guy wasn’t that tall and from what he could see, he wasn’t playing that much of a role as well.
He just stood there, gazing into the distance.
’Maybe he’s a guard.’
As much as he would like to shoot the important ones in the distance, this was the only option he had.
’Better than nothing.’
Taking aim, Mikhail positioned his gun just slightly above the head.
He couldn’t see the person’s face from here.
On the other hand, Mikhail started to perform hand signs again from his free hand.
"Cindralis."
The spell diagram appeared in front of him again.
"Fumivex."
The second node on the diagram lit up, joining the line to the first one.
"Morphis."
The third nod lit up, lighting the whole spell diagram ablaze.
"Cindralic Morphis."
And then...
BOOM!
__________________

chapters.title: Chapter 16: Final Step
chapters.content:
Chapter 16: Final Step
The sound of a gunshot was heard as a clean beam of blazing fire split through the air.
PLUNGE! BOOM!
It didn’t even take a second for it to be over.
A shower of blood exploded into the vicinity as the figure’s head burst apart.
And then, it was all chaos.
At that moment, every figure’s head snapped toward the headless member’s body on the ground.
Mikhail wasted no time taking advantage of the confusion and chaos.
As much as he would have liked to hunt them from the trees, he had made an oath.
"Norvalis Morphis."
A wispy smoke covered his legs and feet as the words escaped his lips.
Click. Cluck.
The next moment, he jumped outside of the trees into the field.
Landing on the grass, however, his feet made no sound at all.
The spell completely suppressed it.
’I need to get this done quickly.’
He could already feel his mana dwindling rapidly.
The oath had attuned the frequency of his attacks perfectly to the gates.
His eyes moved to the seven gates in the distance.
As expected, he could see the borders of the gates waver.
It was working.
However, there was some good news and bad news.
Since the disturbance frequencies were higher, the oath had heightened his mana frequency levels to match them.
Although due to the oath, it canceled the stress on his body for high-frequency spells...
The mana consumption didn’t remain the same.
Which meant that for each attack he did now, he couldn’t adjust the mana consumption.
It would remain high all throughout the battle.
He could only hope it was enough to close the gates now.
Focusing his attention on the front, Mikhail saw that the Silent Pact members had already gotten alert.
THUMP! RAWRR!
Suddenly, the ground shook with a tremor, almost throwing everyone off balance.
Mikhail quickly reacted, planting his feet on the ground.
But it wasn’t over just yet.
He felt the hair on his back stand up and his instincts screaming for him to jump.
And that was what he did.
THUD!
Mikhail had never been so fortunate to jump, as the instant that he did, a gigantic foot smashed on the ground.
Hiding in the clouds of dust, Mikhail looked up in the sky to see a humongous monster.
Almost the size of a dinosaur.
’Their control probably shook with that surprise.’
It was the only reason that came to his mind.
And it seemed to be correct, as he saw the monsters change their direction to the gates again.
’I need to utilize this to my advantage.’
Hiding in the dust, Mikhail wasted no time to attack again.
"Cindralis."
He made the sign, igniting the spell diagram once more.
"Fumivex."
The second node.
"Morphis."
And the third.
"Cindralic Morphis."
Shooting through the dust, Mikhail came right face to face with the Silent Pact group.
As expected, the members wasted no time sensing his presence, despite the stealth spell.
"It’s the intruder!"
He heard someone yell, alerting everyone as well.
’Not yet, I need to get closer.’
"Aqualis Boltium!"
Twisting on his center of gravity, Mikhail easily dodged the two hydro-bullets.
But it wasn’t the end of their attacks just yet.
"Borealic Bladis."
A series of azure blades split through the wind, aimed toward him.
SWOOSH!
However, Mikhail still didn’t hold his charge. Planting his feet onto the ground, he jumped hard into the air.
"Aqualis Bormis."
A stream of water shot out from his hands, keeping him in the air.
SWISH! SWOOSH!
With experienced movements, Mikhail effortlessly maneuvered mid-air, dodging the blades with his water streams.
’Close.’
Mikhail’s attempt to get close wasn’t just to deal more damage to them in close combat.
It was to keep them stressed and occupied so they wouldn’t notice the gates shrinking.
"Keep your distance, don’t let him get close!" Mikhail heard the one farthest yell.
’No, you don’t.’
Mikhail blasted his water beams at the ground, raising a cloud of dust.
Canceling the spell, he shot to the ground with his Norvalis spell still active.
Wasting no time, he shot towards the nearest member to him in the dust, remembering the positions from above.
As his figure split through the cloud, he saw the member’s eyes widen.
’From his reaction, it seems they still don’t know about my Norvalis Essentia.’
The figure quickly raised his hands, sending another Borealic Bladis toward him.
But Mikhail’s instincts were faster.
Twisting his heel, he bent his back, dodging the blade while continuing his charge.
The pain that came with the sudden movement was nothing new to him.
The member’s body stiffened as Mikhail finally reached him.
Raising his gun, Mikhail pointed it straight at his head.
"Cindralic Morphis."
BOOM—
’What?’
TING! SWOOSH!
His flaming bullet bounced right off the cape as if the clothing was a piece of metal.
’This didn’t happen before.’
Mikhail could feel the member underneath the hood smile wickedly at his surprise.
And the latter wasted no time utilizing the opportunity as well.
"Aqualis Boltium!"
The bullet pierced Mikhail right in the shoulder, springing forth a splash of blood.
Pain shot through Mikhail’s body, but the black-haired soldier showed no sign of it on his face.
It didn’t even halt his movement, as if it was normal.
"It’s going to take you more than this," Mikhail said.
Grabbing the man’s arm, he spun him in the air, slamming him on the ground while ducking to dodge a bullet at the same time.
A cry of pain erupted from the man’s mouth, which was visible to Mikhail now.
Pointing his gun to his forehead, he pulled the trigger.
BOOM!
A single loud shot echoed in the surroundings, easily ending the man’s life.
Mikhail didn’t even use magic for this kill.
One simple bullet was enough.
Click. Cluck.
Tilting his head to dodge another bullet, Mikhail shot forward again.
"Next."
But the moment he did, the ground shook once more, this time with a worse intensity than before.
It ended up throwing him off balance along with everyone.
RUMBLE! RUMBLE! RUMBLE!
Mikhail’s eyes shot toward the source like each member, the worst possibility already running in his head.
Just like he thought, it turned out to be true.
The shaking wasn’t caused by the monsters this time.
It was done by the wormholes, the air rippling under their shrinking pressure
Unfortunately for him, though, everyone knew about it now.
___________________

chapters.title: Chapter 17: Final Spell
chapters.content:
Chapter 17: Final Spell
It was a disaster.
Mikhail’s eyes snapped towards the group, horrified expressions etched on their faces now.
"You bastards! Maintain the disturbance frequencies!" One of the members at the forefront shouted.
"Beast tamers! Maintain control over the beasts, you will kill everyone here!"
’He’s the leader.’
Mikhail was quite sure of it now.
Focusing on him, even the energy and power oozing off of him was unlike any other.
’Herald rank?’
If so, it would prove to be quite a problem for him.
But there was another bigger issue now.
"Cindralic Bladis."
"Borealic Boltium."
"Aqualis Morphis."
’Shoot.’
A barrage of spells were launched his way, both in an attempt to nullify him and raise the disturbance frequencies.
Taking advantage of the remaining dust, Mikhail hid his hand behind his back.
He performed the hand sign for Aqualis.
First node.
Then for Fumivex.
Second node.
And then for Morphis.
Third node.
"Aqualis Morphis."
BOOM!
But the signs didn’t just stop there.
He synced them to another spell stream, now performing the hand signs of another spell.
In a matter of two seconds, he performed three spells.
"Cindralic Morphis."
BOOOM!
"Cindralic Hurrialis."
SWOOSH!
A scorching hurricane of crimson launched forth through the dust, Mikhail’s bullets arching through it.
The incoming barrage of spells was completely demolished in front of the vortex, not even lasting a second.
That was the difference in strength between a spell and pre-spell.
The group was thrown into chaos as they quickly tried to split and dodge the incoming hurl of fire.
But in that quickness, they failed to see the two bullets that shot forth, striking two of the members in their leg.
Surprisingly, unlike last time, the robe that they wore provided no protection.
The edges of Mikhail’s lips almost curled up with satisfaction.
’As I thought, the ones with protection are artifacts, with shining gold embroidery.’
"Argh!" He heard the two members scream in pain, their charge halting.
Now was his chance.
But the moment he raised his gun to shoot, a piercing pain shot through his spine.
His face scrunched up in irritation as his body froze, already knowing the reason behind it.
Of course, the quick succession of spells came with a price.
Usually, after you cast a spell, the caster had a cooldown period for casting another spell.
The period varied according to the strength and qualities of the spell.
Regardless, even the basic of spells had a cooldown period of a few seconds.
Pushing yourself to cast another spell in that period would just put more and more toll on your body.
In certain cases, it could lead to permanent physical damage of mana veins or cause conditions like blindness, even crippling a person sometimes.
For a person of Mikhail’s rank, their spell topology would just break when they would try to cast another spell.
But with his Dragma, Mikhail was able to cheat this limitation.
Unfortunately, not the limitations on his body though.
Currently, his mana veins inside the body were facing the aftereffects of casting three spells at once.
’Move, you weak body!’
Mikhail tried to move, but it was unfortunately to no avail.
And in that time, it was enough for the opposing force to attack back.
CRUNCH!
A crunching kick was delivered right to Mikhail’s face from the side, sending his body crashing down the trees.
CRASH!
"Argh!"
He tasted iron as the sudden impact sent blood gurgling out of his mouth.
Mikhail’s vision spun, the blood from the wound on his now dripping down on his eyes.
’Why is this body so weak?’
His bones ached and cracked from the impact, making him think he broke one or two.
Ahead in the distance, he saw the members of the group cautiously advancing towards him.
There was a wide smirk on the leader’s face underneath the hood was he walked on the front.
Mikhail saw his right leg completely covered in a thick block of ice.
’So it was him....no wonder.’
’I’m definitely not going back in one piece.’
He checked his mana.
—————————
Mana: 1800/6400 [Dragma]
—————————
"Argh!"
He puked up more blood, struggling to move himself.
The sudden increase in the disturbance frequencies had also raised the mana consumption of his attacks.
’At most, I can use Morphis 25 to 30 times now or Hurialis 5 to 6 times.’
It was most definitely not enough to eradicate the whole group.
But...
Mikhail gazed ahead into the distance, where he could see the gates.
They had shrunk again to a size much smaller than the original.
At most, he needed to keep it going for 2 minutes now.
Fortunately, they hadn’t run an eye on it again after raising the frequencies.
’I can’t have them noticing it again.’
If they did, then he was definitely done for.
But Mikhail could see the signs of tiredness in the member’s bodies.
He couldn’t see their faces but he could definitely see it from their movements.
’Their control is wavering. Even over the monsters.’
He could see the erratic movements in the monsters in the distance, showing that they were regaining some semblance of control.
’They can’t hold it for long-’
"Argh!"
Another wave of pain shot through his body as Mikhail threw up more blood.
His lush black hair and face was drenched in blood from his wound now, his piercing blue eyes locked onto the members.
’I can feel my consciousness fading...’
The blood loss was hitting him.
The group was almost near him now.
’I can’t run fast enough in this state to escape them.’
He realized.
Mikhail needed a distraction to get up again.
Just one shot.
One single shot.
His calm blue eyes ran over the members in a split second, as if trying to find something.
Fortunately for him, that moment was right there.
’There it is.’
Step.
They were only a few steps away from him now.
Mikhail needed to act fast.
Bearing the pain, he hid his hand underneath his thigh.
Bending two fingers, he made the hand-sign for another spell.
’Cindralis.’
Before the spell diagram could appear, Mikhail quickly made the signs of the second and third node.
’Fumivex.’
’Morphis.’
Mikhail heard the leader speaking something to him, but it all came to him as muffled sounds.
"You tried your best kid....unfortunately..."
It didn’t matter to him right now, his focus was on something else.
Wasting no moment, he raised his gun and pulled the trigger.
"Cindralic Morphis."
It didn’t even take a moment for the blazing bullet to go tearing through the air, giving the group no time to react.
BOOM!
It connected right with the target’s shoulder but unfortunately, despite the strength it carried, it was reflected straight forward.
Giving no harm to the target.
Mikhail saw an expression of rage and surprise in the leader’s eyes as he realized what happened.
He saw certain shouts erupt out of his mouth but at this point, he could hear nothing.
He walked up to Mikhail with an evil smirk on his face now, the group laughing hysterically behind him.
"I don’t know how you pulled off that last ditch effort kid, but at least you should have used some brains."
Mikhail heard it perfectly now that he spoke in a low voice from up close.
’Just there.’
He saw him raise his large ice-clad foot high in the air, positioning it in front of his face.
Mikhail heard him laugh once more, a creepy evil laugh.
"I’ll at least give you the honor to choose your last words. Go ahead." He grinned.
Mikhail almost felt the corners of his mouth pulling up as his calm blue eyes stared into him.
Rather than saying a word, he simply raised his hand in the air.
Or rather, two fingers to be exact.
Step. Step. Step.
Pointing the two fingers to his eyes, Mikhail saw the leader tilt his head in confusion.
Step. Step. Step.
But then, he turned his two fingers sharply to his left, as if gesturing him to look to the left.
Understanding what he was trying to say, the leader burst out laughing.
Step. Step. Step.
"You really thought I would fall for-"
SLASH!
"You fucked up." Mikhail moved.
__________________

chapters.title: Chapter 18: End Of The Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 18: End Of The Battle
"Cindralic Morphis"
BOOM!
The flaming bullet tore through the leader’s neck, spilling forth a fountain of blood.
’Oh? He’s not Herald ranked.’
If he was, the bullet wouldn’t have inflicted so much damage.
Which meant he was the same rank as Mikhail.
Unfortunately, he still wasn’t dead despite the critical shot.
But first, he needed to get done with the beasts and the other mages.
’Let me disable him.’
Click. Cluck.
BOOM! BOOM!
A bloody scream escaped the leader’s mouth as Mikhail shot him two times in the feet.
His dying body crashed on the ground but Mikhail had already moved ahead.
"Control it! What’s happening!?" Mikhail heard the members shouting.
It was all chaos now as hordes of smaller monsters came rushing after them.
What Mikhail had done back there was simple.
With the holes shrinking, the size of the monsters able to shift through the gates had grown smaller as well.
The previous mammoth sized monsters weren’t able to cross into the real world anymore.
With the focus of the whole group on him, Mikhail assured them that they were unable to realize this fact.
They were just controlling the monsters that came out with instinct.
This was confirmed to Mikhail when he ran an eye over the group.
He saw three of the members just moving their hands in a pattern within the robe, their focus on him.
When he shot at one of the members, it was never his point to injure them.
No.
He already knew that the controllers and disrupters had the artifact robes.
The bullet he shot there served two purposes.
One was to momentarily break the control of the tamers over the incoming monsters with the impact.
Which he was able to when it striked their robes, disrupting their control.
And the second purpose was to divert the uncontrolled monsters toward him.
Which he did when that reflected bullet went striking back among the monsters.
His aim made it sure that it would hit the new monsters coming from the gate.
That hit not only enraged the monsters to come running towards him, mistaking the group as the attackers.
But also if the controllers were to notice them, it would be impossible to take them under control.
The more enraged the monster, the harder it was to control it. It was a simple rule that everyone knew.
Fortunately for Mikhail though, the stealthy nature of the beasts didn’t allow the group to sense them.
Mikhail knew the beasts.
Milton Raptors.
Their body was almost a mix of raptors and leopards, combining both speed and stealth.
Their prideful and hot temper made it so that whenever they would see a foe, they would attack the strongest of the group.
Which in Mikhail’s case, was the leader of the group at that time.
The robe didn’t protect the person from physical damage, Mikhail had already confirmed that.
’I need to keep using spells or the gates will start opening again.’
Fortunately, now the leader was out of the fray.
So there was complete disarray in the group.
"Norvalis Morphis"
Silencing his footsteps, Mikhail blended in with the now ensuing chaos of monsters.
’The raptors won’t attack me for now. I’m too weak for them to consider me as their prey.’
His previous life knowledge from the battlefield was coming to work now.
"Aqualis Boltium."
’No you don’t.’
"Cindralic Morphis."
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
Mikhail countered their spells with his own, protecting the monsters.
Right now, his safest bet to survive this was with their help.
Without them, he was still too weak to handle them all, even with their leader gone.
Reaching a member near him, Mikhail raised his gun to his head.
"Aqualis Morphis."
BOOM! SPLASH!
A fountain of blood sprung forth, splashing on him.
Ignoring, Mikhail spun on his heel to move to the next member when a crunching pain hit his back.
Gritting his teeth to bear through the teeth, he moved on his torso.
BOOM! BOOM!
Putting two shots straight to the head of the raptor, he fell to the ground, panting heavily.
"Huff....Huff...." He saw his vision blur, almost falling unconscious but the urgency of the situation kept him going.
’I can’t hold on for long.’
Running a hazy eye over the battlefield, he saw the controllers nowhere to be found.
They were controlling some of the beasts from somewhere.
’Shit, I can’t make sense of who’s controlled or not.’
It would be a problem if he attacked the uncontrolled ones, bringing even more fight to himself.
He quickly checked his mana, only to find it down to 900.
There was no point in choosing his enemies now.
His mana was only left to close the gates. It didn’t matter whom he shot, he just needed to close the remaining gates.
Biting his lip to keep himself conscious, Mikhail tried to rise to his feet.
Crunch. Drip.
His body condition was a total mess right now. Broken bones, ribs and blood loss.
And now he was about to go on a spell overload.
’Whatever, not the first time this will happen.’
Click. Cluck. Click. Cluck.
Raising his guns, he took aim straight at a member in the distance, who was already occupied with 3 raptors.
"Norvalis Morphis"
Ting.
The sound was completely suppressed to a ting as the bullet split through the member’s head.
As his lifeless body fell down, Mikhail saw the raptors pounce upon him.
"..!"
His instincts screamed for him to dive to the right.
And he did, ignoring the gut-wrenching pain that came with it in the process.
His eyes moved to the back where he saw 3 raptors slash through the air where he stood before.
He took aim with his guns once more.
"Cindralic Hurialis."
"Cindralic Morphis."
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
Mikhail’s shots split through the brains of every raptor caught in the crimson vortex
"Argh!!"
He crashed on the ground as he tried to stand up again, blood dripping on the floor from his wounds and mouth.
He smashed his fist on the ground, anger coming over him for the first time.
’Fuck this body. Stand up!’
"..!"
Rolling over the ground, he quickly pointed his guns to the back.
"Norvalis Boltium."
A barrage of smoke bullets cut through their bodies, sending them crashing on the ground.
"Huff...Huff..."
The side-effects of mana overload were hitting him now.
With one eye open only now, Mikhail gazed over at the gates.
It was no larger than a small hole now.
No monster was able to come out from a hole of that size.
But the work still wasn’t done, he needed to close them completely or those disruptors would open them again.
’I can’t be bothered to find those controllers right now.’
Forcing himself up on his knees, he ran a quick look over the battlefield, his eye searching for any shine of gold.
And there it was.
In the distance, he found it. Right behind the trees.
’I’ll finish this in one last attack.’
That was all he could muster now.
Scraping his knees on the ground, Mikhail pushed his feet against the dirt, propelling himself forward for one last charge.
Skrrt! Swoosh!
As he ran through the area, he loaded his guns for one last shot.
One last barrage of spells.
Unfortunately, the controllers were quick to realize his direction.
GROWL!
Mikhail heard 3 monstrous cries from right behind him.
’Fuck!’
Bending his ankle, he quickly changed his direction mid-charge.
Crack!
The sudden twist sent a streak of pain through his ankle, breaking it.
But it was too late to stop for another second now.
Raising his bloody hand for one last time in the air, he performed the symbols.
’Cindralis.’
First node.
’Fumivex.’
Second node.
’Spinora.’
Third node.
And complete.
"Cindralic Hurialis."
With the highest amount of mana he could put, Mikhail pushed the spell forward.
SWOOOSH!
And it worked as a gigantic hurricane of fire sprung forth, devouring everything within it.
Mikhail saw the disruptors quickly try to escape its grasp but unfortunately, it was too late.
They were thrown right in with the pack of raptors.
Crashing on the ground with his world spinning now, Mikhail forced his single eye up to the hurricane.
There was one single reason why he had used Hurrialis despite its high mana consumption.
It was to throw their hoods off, providing a clean look on who they were.
And to provide a clean target for him to aim at.
SWOOSH!
Just like he expected, the scorching winds sent their hoods whipping back, revealing their faces.
Mikhail’s eye widened with realization.
’Ah...’
’I should have suspected it from the start.’
Right before him, in the hurricane were the same new guards he saw at the gate on his first day.
’No wonder the academy security system didn’t pick them up.’
Regardless...
It didn’t change his motive.
Click....Clunk.
Mikhail loaded his gun with the last bullet he had.
’Fuck, I’m losing conciousness....’
His vision spun, making his aim harder.
But...
’That would be the last thing stopping me from putting a bullet in their head.’
These guns were an extension of his body. Shooting was as natural to him as breathing.
Raising his gun as he laid on the ground, Mikhail took aim once more.
Not at their heads but at a certain point in the hurricane.
Step. Step. Step.
He could hear footsteps coming from behind.
But his form or focus didn’t waver.
And after a few seconds, as soon as their heads aligned with his predicted aim, the spell canceled automatically.
"Cindralic Morphis."
It was the last spell he could use.
BOOM! BOOM!
__________________________

chapters.title: Chapter 19: Trip Down The Memory Lane
chapters.content:
Chapter 19: Trip Down The Memory Lane
BOOM! BOOM!
The gunshots cleanly pierced through the guard’s head, their lifeless bodies falling to the ground.
Feeling his consciousness fading, Mikhail saw the 7 wormholes closing for once and all.
But as he succumbed to the darkness, he saw the two last remaining controllers of the group advancing towards him.
’Fuck.’
Unfortunately, he had no energy left in him to do anything now.
In the final second, he saw them nearing toward him with furious expressions on their faces.
’Such an early end-’
SLASH!
Before he could understand what happened, dark overtook him.
The headless bodies of the two advancing controllers was the last thing he saw.
***
In the remains of a destructive and fierce battle, a figure could be seen descending from the sky.
Their silent but fierce presence made it seem as if the world was put on hold.
The strewn bodies of soldiers and monsters on the crimson-blanketed ground didn’t matter.
Their eyes were locked to a single man who lay unconscious on the battlefield.
And the only one still alive.
His condition was fatal, to say the least.
The torn clothes were drenched in blood, the majority of it being his own.
Deep gashes and wounds covered his whole body, making his face almost unrecognizable at a glance.
The leaking blood pooled around his body as the black-haired man drifted to death with every passing second.
But unlike one would expect, his expression seemed to betray his condition.
It was one of peace and calm, as if what just happened to him didn’t matter.
As if he was at peace with what just happened.
The wind whipped and pooled around the ground as the figure softly stepped on the ground, cushioning the step.
Their emerald eyes were still fixated on the man’s body.
Despite the man’s condition though, there was no sign of empathy or worry in the figure’s eyes.
Rather, it was one of curiosity and intrigue.
In the midst of the battlefield, it was her soft voice to break the stretching silence.
"Interesting."
***
’Hmm?’
Mikhail’s eyes opened to a small wooden house.
Warm unfiltered sunlight entered through the open window, illuminating the simple interior of the house.
’Why are the walls so big-’
Mikhail was unable to complete his thoughts as he felt his body move automatically.
’What?’
He couldn’t control the person’s body which he was currently in, only seeing the world through their eyes.
’Why is the world so bi-’
Realization finally hit him.
He was in the body of a child.
’No wonder.’
Despite his large view, the house wasn’t that large from a general view.
It could barely even be called a house if he had to be honest, as it was no larger than a normal room.
It was definitely larger than their individual camp tents though.
But...
’Why does this seem so-’
Before he could complete his thought, the boy suddenly moved from his bed.
"Ungh."
With his small body, he carefully got down the wooden bed, running to the door.
Not being able to reach the handle, he hurriedly ran towards a nearby corner.
From there, he carefully inserted his small hand inside of a small gap within the wooden planks.
Taking out a small crowbar, he inserted it under the gap of the door.
"Hngh!" He pulled with all the little strength he had.
Creak...
With a creaking noise, the door was let out of the handle, opening up the entrance for him.
Mikhail felt joy well up within him, or rather the boy at his success.
Running back to the gap, he put the crowbar inside, hiding it carefully.
Following that, he ran to a nearby table, not caring about losing his breath.
It seemed as if he was in a hurry.
’Why does this-’
His eyes widened when he saw the boy pick up a book from the table.
The cover wasn’t all that shiny or well-kept, even torn from the edges a little.
But it was the title that left him surprised.
’21 Stories Of Freedom And Love’
Before he could think anything about it again, he was taken by surprise when the boy happily rushed out of the house.
There was a rising sense of happiness and enjoyment within him.
Almost as if it was the best moment of the day in the boy’s daily life.
But the ongoing question still plagued Mikhail.
Why was he enjoying this? And why did it feel so familiar?
The boy couldn’t be him.
There was no memory in his early life where he ever did this.
The difference was of heaven and earth.
But then, why?
’I need more information.’
For now, all he could do was just see what happened later on with the boy.
Coming out of the house, he saw the bright sunlight hit him straight in the eyes.
As he adjusted to the brightness, the view before him became clear to his eyes.
’It looks like a village.’
There were wooden black houses all around, placed at even distance on the sides of the ground he was standing on.
But there was something strange...
The streets. Or rather, the whole village..
Was completely empty.
Not a single person could be seen in the area.
’What is this place?’
He was certainly sure that he never knew any place like this or even similar to this.
It made no sense.
The boy moved once more.
But unlike what Mikhail was expecting, he didn’t run through the streets of the village.
Rather, he snuck around to the back of the house, as if hiding from something.
Sneaking around in the long grass and behind the trees, the boy hid in the shadows.
Mikhail saw him keep moving like this until he reached an exact same house as before at the end of the street.
From there, he saw the boy look around at the backside of the house, as if trying to find something.
It was then that a voice entered the boy’s ears.
"Here." It was a soft whisper of a girl.
A warm feeling of joy rose in the boy’s chest as he quickly ran to the voice.
There, in the corner of the house and hidden in the long grass, he saw a little girl.
But...
’What the hell?’
The girl’s face..
He couldn’t see it.

chapters.title: Chapter 20: Back To Reality
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Back To Reality
It all appeared as a glitching blur to him, with only her smile available for him to see.
Just like the boy, she had a warm and teasing smile on her face.
She quickly put a finger to her lips before the boy could say something.
"Shhhh, hold your excitement." She whispered.
The boy finally realized where he was and nodded, scratching his head in embarrassment.
The girl chuckled, standing up as the boy gave her his hand.
It was only then that Mikhail realized that she seemed to be older than the boy, standing taller than him.
Of course, he could be wrong as he was only judging from the height.
"Let’s go." She whispered, not leaving his hand.
The boy nodded happily, the two quickly running away from the houses in the long grass.
Mikhail saw the two head down the long grass and trees for a few minutes before finally stopping.
There, before him, stretched a large lake, the clean water shining under the sunlight.
"There." The girl whispered, gesturing to a spot under the shade of a tree right by the lake.
Even though they were quite a distance away from the village, the girl was still whispering.
’They are hiding from something.’
That much was confirmed.
As the two sat down under the shade hand-in-hand, Mikhail felt a rising warmth in him.
’This boy...’
From what he could tell from just his emotions, it looked like the girl meant the world to him.
The current moment was his happiest time of the day.
But why...
’Why do I feel so attached to her as well?’
Why did it still feel so familiar?
Nothing. He could remember not a single moment from this dream that had happened in his past.
’It must be since I’m in the boy’s body.’
He was seeing what he was seeing. He was feeling what he was feeling.
That was the only reasonable explanation.
Under the shade of the tree, Mikhail saw the two happily enjoy the breeze of the wind, looking out over the lake.
It was then that he saw the boy take out the story book from his back.
The instant that he did, he saw a blush come up on the girl’s lips.
"You brought it?" She asked, almost saying it out loud from her excitement and happiness.
"Un." The boy nodded cheerfully.
Mikhail saw the girl’s smile turn wider as she pulled the boy into a hug.
Calming the girl down, the boy opened the book, turning to a specific page number.
’This doesn’t seem to be the first time he’s doing this.’
The two happily poked their heads in the book, with the boy tracing his small finger over the words so the girl wouldn’t lose track.
They read silently and blissfully, enjoying each other’s company.
Time stretched for a long time before Mikhail saw the boy take a loud yawn.
"Are you sleepy?" The girl whispered, chuckling.
The boy nodded after a moment from embarrassment, trying to hide his face.
"You didn’t sleep last night?" she asked.
The boy stopped, frozen at her question.
But after a moment, he nodded slowly again, trying to hide the blush that was creeping on his face.
Mikhail saw the girl laugh, the cheerful smile on her face spreading wider.
"It’s okay," she said, adjusting her position before putting his head in her lap.
"You can rest for a while here before we leave." She chuckled, ruffling his hair.
Mikhail saw the boy freeze at the sudden movement, embarrassment welling up in him.
But more than embarrassment was happiness and enjoyment.
It was clear that he was loving it.
"Come on now, don’t waste your time and close your eyes." She pouted.
The boy hurriedly nodded, not wanting to make her sad.
"Un." He closed his eyes, not able to see the smile that returned on her face.
"Good boy." She ran a hand through his hair.
Darkness overtook Mikhail as well when the boy closed his eyes, now only being able to hear the girl’s voice.
"Rest and sleep well."
Her soothing voice hit like a comfortable pillow to the boy’s ears, tiredness overtaking him.
Unfortunately, Mikhail knew that this dream wouldn’t just be a happy one.
There was definitely something up.
And he was right when he heard a sharp cry of pain from the girl in the distance, his eyes opening with a snap.
Mikhail, or rather, the boy woke up to being dragged by a group of people, fully covered in black.
In the distance, he could also see the girl being dealt the same treatment by another group.
The boy’s shocked eyes met the girl, who had tears streaming down her face now.
A sense of struggle and desperation overtook the boy as he tried to force himself to break free.
Unfortunately, he was too weak.
His hand stretched out in a hopeless attempt to grab the girl despite the distance.
And the girl did the same.
Mikhail could feel the pain and hopelessness in the boy as he saw the girl being dragged away from him.
It was as if his world was breaking down into pieces.
Not just the boy...
But Mikhail as well.
He didn’t know the girl.
He didn’t know the boy either.
He didn’t know anything that was going on.
But then...
’
Why does it feel so damn familiar!?’
He cried out, his thoughts unable to get out.
Why did the boy’s pain and desperation feel as if it were his own!?
Why did he want to fight those captors for the girl?
As Mikhail saw the girl being taken away from his vision, he cried out loud, despite knowing his voice couldn’t be heard.
Just like the boy.
"NOOOOO!"
At that moment, the world around him disappeared with a snap, his body shooting up from his bed.
The scene around him changed to the infirmary where he saw his squadron around him, worried looks in their eyes.
His clothes were drenched in sweat, with his breath coming out in hurried gasps.
Mikhail was back.
Back to the real world.
And a notification appeared before him.
—————〔Chronicle I〕—————
• Condition: Uncover the assassination and save your academy from getting destroyed.
[Rewards:]
• Character Progression: +15% [Granted]
• Mana Increase: +300 [Granted]
[Status: Completed]
———————————————

chapters.title: Chapter 21: Reports (Interlude)
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Reports (Interlude)
"What happened!?" The infirmary doctor rushed in.
Mikhail’s panicked eyes saw everyone staring at him worriedly, realizing now that he was back to reality.
’What the hell was that dream?’
Calmness returned to Mikhail as his breathing settled down.
"Are you feeling alright?" The doctor asked, trying to examine Mikhail physically.
"I’m fine. Can you leave us alone for a while?"
The doctor looked at Mikhail strangely, almost about to refuse when Modric stood up.
"He’s our Squadron Commander. I’m sure he knows of himself so please allow him some space to settle down."
The doctor gulped, hesitating before speaking up.
"If so, then I’ll need to ask you people to leave as well. It’s the only way I can leave the patient alone."
Modric was about to interject before Mikhail stepped in.
"That’s fine. Though, I’ll ask you to leave Modric with me as my Vice-Commander."
Modric’s eyes met Mikhail’s, both of them communicating with their thoughts.
’It’s fine, I can convince him to let the whole squadron stay.’
’Don’t. It would just cause more problems. Just you are fine.’
’If you say so.’
The two looked at the doctor who hesitatingly nodded.
"Alright. But do know if something happens to the patient, that will be on you, yourself."
"We understand."
The doctor gave them a gruff nod before leaving out the door.
It was his way of saying
’I don’t really care about you but I have to since it’s my duty. If you die, that’s on you.’
Mikhail gave a single glance to the rest of the group and they nodded, standing up.
"I appreciate it." He gave them a grateful smile.
"Don’t worry about it. Rest well." He tapped his shoulder.
"You’ll have to tell me what you did back there when you come back though." Icarus pouted.
Mikhail laughed lightly.
"Sure."
"I’m glad you are fine." Yvan gave him a relieved smile, tapping his shoulder before joining the group.
But before they could leave, Mikhail called them all out.
"You all."
They turned, confused.
"I’m glad you all are fine and I’m proud of how you handled that situation."
Surprise instantly came on their faces, even the usually calm Modric.
"Man, you are going to make me cry." Icarus wiped his eyes to clear his fake tears.
"Since when was Mika so kind?" Oscar looked around with shock.
The only ones who just seemed to look at him with shock were Modric and Yvan.
The reason for their reactions was his compliment.
All of them knew Mikhail to be a man of few words. They could not remember the last time he had complimented them.
But when he did, despite it being a simple few words, it brought them a whole nother level of satisfaction and happiness.
Mikhail gave them one of his rare appreciative smiles.
Their expressions turned from shock to cheerfulness now, as all of them hit a salute.
"You can count on us."
Mikhail nodded and all of them turned to leave.
As the door closed, the former turned to look at Modric now, his smile disappearing to an expression of dead seriousness.
Modric nodded, already understanding what he wanted to ask.
He knew that Mikhail hadn’t stopped him to discuss what happened to him or his health.
"48 men died. 2 Wardens and 46 Magus."
He got straight to the point.
Silence settled in the room as both of them paid their mutual respects.
Despite not caring about them or even knowing them, Mikhail at least knew to respect the dead.
Especially the ones who died fighting.
Turning to his thoughts, however, Mikhail was satisfied.
74 wasn’t a small number. Rather it was a grave loss.
But it turned out to be much better than his previous life where at least 84 ended up dying.
’My involvement definitely helped.’
As the silence ended, Modric continued automatically.
"93 people were injured. 68 of them, light injuries. 9 or 10, heavy injuries. 5 to 6 with fatal injuries or loss of an organ."
Mikhail nodded.
’Better than last time as well.’
It was well-worth all the pain he had to go through.
"The infrastructure damages are still being calculated so we are unsure about that."
’Hmm..’
He turned to Modric.
"How long was I out for?"
"A day."
Surprise came over Mikhail at how early he had woken up.
’I thought it would take more considering my injur-’
He was interrupted by Modric’s words.
"You were only diagnosed with mana overload and tiredness so it didn’t take long to fix you up."
Mikhail’s eyes widened with shock.
’Huh? What?’
Impossible.
Mana overload was the least of what he had gone through in that battle.
He had broken bones, mana exhaustion, concussions and so much.
’How the hell?’
"Is something wrong?" Modric asked at Mikhail’s expression.
"Nothing. I was just surprised at how early I woke up." The latter shook his head.
Modric’s golden eyes bore into him but he didn’t pry further.
"I see."
It was then that Mikhail realized something.
’Wait..’
"Who brought me here?"
Something didn’t add up.
The person who found him at the battlefield must have seen his injurie-
"From what they told us, you were found at the gate by the academy reinforcements. Unconscious, they brought you here and informed us."
’What?’
Mikhail hid the surprise and confusion inside him.
"I see, alright."
Who found him from there and brought him here?
It was then that he remembered a memory before passing out.
SLASH! SLASH!
The two controllers that were running towards him were killed in a single second.
Even their artifacts couldn’t hold up.
’Was that reinforcement squad?’
Mikhail wasn’t sure.
But he needed to find out who it was that rescued him.
’They were certainly strong.’
He would just look into it later when he would get discharged.
Mikhail turned back to Modric, who still stood attentively for any questions.
"Anything else worth mentioning?"
"Well..." Modric trailed off for the first time, confusing Mikhail.
He had even reported the deaths without any remorse.
So why was he hesitating now?
"Hmm? What happened?"
"Well, about the Dominique."
It was only then did Mikhail remember about her visit.
’Did something happen to her?’
It was unlikely considering how strong she was. She could have single-handedly closed all the 7 gates if she wanted.
Then what else?
"What about her?"
"In the middle of the attack, she decided something."
"What was it?"
Modric sighed, stopped for a second, before speaking again.
"She decided to shut down this camp because of the lack of security and checkups."
________________

chapters.title: Chapter 22: Tree Of Yggdrasil
chapters.content:
Chapter 22: Tree Of Yggdrasil
"What?" Mikhail blurted out, unable to control his surprise.
This hadn’t happened in his previous life even with all those deaths.
Then why now?
But before Mikhail could ask again, Modric already relieved his worries.
"Well, that was what she said first. After the battle, she changed her decision for some reason."
’Huh?’
Seeing Mikhail’s expression, Modric continued.
"Yes, that’s what she said, refusing to elaborate further. Although she refused to report this incident to the Empire, she stated that from now on, the camp will be subjected to multiple visits in a year."
’This is different.’
None of this had happened in his previous life when she just left, despite the number of the deaths.
Then why?
What happened during the middle of the battle to make her change her mind?
He needed to find out.
Before he could conclude the conversation, Modric added more.
"Not only that, but she stated that all of the visits would be done by her. And any more breaches would make her permanently shut down the academy."
"Hmmm.." A thoughtful expression appeared on Mikhail’s face.
This was intriguing.
He needed time to think about this new information. Time to process it himself alone.
"Alright, you can leave now."
Nodding, Modric did a customary salute before turning to the door to leave.
"Thanks for your efforts, Mord."
The others called him but Mikhail called him ’Mord’. Something he only did.
Modric didn’t mind whatever he was called.
That didn’t mean that the boy had no emotions. He did.
Just as much as everyone. He just didn’t know how to express them.
But in any case, Mikhail genuinely meant the compliment.
If not for Modric, he could have definitely never gotten this mission done.
The understanding the two had for each other was top-tier.
Modric didn’t turn back to look, standing frozen at the door with his hand on the knob.
Mikhail took this chance to joke between them after a long while.
"I’m not smiling like a girl, you are."
Immediately, Modric stuttered."
"S-shut up, bastard."
Opening the door, he quickly stepped out and slammed the door shut.
But as he left, the wind carried a message in Mikhail’s ears.
"No problem but...trust us more or at least, me."
As the words trailed off, a laugh escaped from Mikhail’s mouth.
’So he knew after all.’
These people knew him too well.
***
[At Night]
Mikhail stepped out of the infirmary, finally discharged.
He stretched his arms in the air, feeling constricted after all that time.
But except the physical tiredness, he was feeling all well.
No signs of mana overload or anything.
’I should check my Spirit Tree.’
Closing his eyes, he focused on reaching his spirit pool and instantly, he felt his consciousness fading.
His senses warped and distorted but he felt no weirdness.
It used to be present for everyone at the start but now it felt normal.
As the distortion went away, Mikhail knew he was there.
Opening his eyes, Mikhail was greeted by an ever stretching expanse of darkness.
Except a single source of light, nothing could be seen in the place.
Except that source, nothing was present in the place as well for one to see.
Feeling wet, Mikhail looked down, only to see the whole expanse covered in water that came up to his ankles.
’I always forget about this.’
But the sea wasn’t his focus right now.
It was that ginormous source of light in front of him, standing high and tall at the center of the space.
With its grand golden branches stretching high above into the ceiling-less black expanse, Mikhail’s Tree of Yggdrasil looked healthy as ever.
Splush...
Mikhail started to walk towards the tree, parting through the water.
With its gigantic golden body shining as ever, the grandness of the tree reflected in the water.
As Mikhail reached near, he saw golden leaves of the tree floating on the surface of the murky water.
This gigantic tree was called the Tree Of Yggdrasil, or in short, the spirit tree of a person.
As a person advanced through the ranks of a Magus, his spirit tree would grow as well.
Its branches and roots would spread out and it would grow larger.
The leaves of the tree represented the mana of a person.
As a person grew older or their life started to diminish, the leaves would start to fall down.
For demonic entities such as monsters, they had a spirit tree as well.
Unlike Magus’ though, it was called The Tree Of Sephiroth.
Just like humans, they had 5 ranks of progression as well but the effect with each rank-up was different.
The Tree of Yggdrasil represented the human’s journey or ascension towards divinity.
While The Tree of Sephiroth represented the monsters or demon’s journey or descending towards profanity or madness.
To further show this, The Tree of Sephiroth was inverted in the Spirit Sea.
Rather than growing from the ground, it would grow from the top of the expanse.
It was also why each rank induced not just strength changes, but personality and behavioral changes in a person as well.
Looking at his healthy tree, Mikhail knew that he was perfectly fine.
It was then that he realized the completion of the quest.
Before his dream could end, he saw that both of the rewards from his quest had been granted.
He quickly opened his information tab.
—————〔Information〕—————
• Character Progression 0 ––> 15%
• Mana: 6400 ––>6700/6700 [Dragma]
—————————————————–
It was true. His mana had actually increased.
Although, after the quest, he felt the reward to be a little underwhelming as compared to the risk he had gone through.
Looking at the Character Progression, Mikhail still didn’t understand what it meant.
Wait.
’Was this the reason why I had that dream?’
Mikhail still didn’t know what that dream meant. Nor did he have the time to think about it.
He had no idea as to why it would contribute to his character.
’I can only wait and see.’
Wanting to leave, Mikhail closed his Spirit Tree, but the moment he left, something happened.
A leaf fell from his tree.
But not only that, what stood out about it was its color
Rather than shining in a golden light like the rest.
The leaf floating on the surface glowed in crimson-red light.
_____________

chapters.title: Chapter 23: Assessment Tests
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Assessment Tests
[A week later]
Mikhail stepped outside of his camp dorm finding his squadron already assembled outside.
As always, he wasted no time with the group already following behind him.
Walking towards the drill grounds, he looked around at the state of the camp.
’Still a lot to work on.’
A whole week had passed since the incident.
But the reminders of the destruction were still there.
Broken buildings. Broken Glass. Broken Trees and Plants.
Dry blood marks on the ground.
The recovery process was very slow but Mikhail couldn’t blame the camp for it.
The incident wasn’t reported to the Empire so of course, there would be no help provided from them.
The castle was trying to procure resources from other castles and towns in the wilderness for the meantime.
The Stables had also been partly destroyed, making most of the drill routes too long to be checked.
Moreover, Vlahovic had suffered quite many injuries in the battle, so there was no one to direct them.
But despite the losses, Mikhail didn’t fret over the results.
As he had said before, it was much better than last time.
At least one thing the academy maintained was its liveliness with the men.
’Something that was lost in the past life.’
If anything, Mikhail appreciated the Empire not giving the academy any help.
This incident had served as one of the catalysts to open every men’s eyes.
The betrayal they felt when they weren’t saved by their-so-called god, the Dominique, had made them truly realize their situation.
’Everyone has no one to rely on but themselves.’
Entering the grounds, Squadron 21 was quick to go and stand in their position.
The past week had been given off to everyone to recuperate and rest up.
So this was their first call-out ever since the incident.
And as everyone came to stand, for the first time, they came to notice in reality just how many people they lost.
The ground, which almost seemed to be filled to the brim before with this wall of men standing in formation at the edges...
Was now left empty in certain parts.
It was as if the wall of men had cracks in it now, with a lot of people missing from certain squadrons.
In fact, Mikhail could only see 11 squadrons or less that hadn’t lost any member in the fight.
His squadron being one of them.
These 11 squadrons were all the squadrons with 5 members or less.
Or in other words, they were the squadrons that had the strength within themself to fight the monsters.
"Do you feel something different today?" Icarus asked from the back, sensing the energy.
"It isn’t just the silence of the deaths, it feels like some oppressive atmosphere has descended on the ground," he continued.
From the front, Mikhail nodded.
"It is. It’s the squadrons that lost a member or two in the fight. Look at them."
Listening to his words, the whole squadron looked around.
And instantly, they felt the aggressive glares and stares from the mentioned people.
’They are acting like children.’
Rather than blaming it on the stronger people, they should just blame themselves for their weakness.
’But of course, it’s much easier to find flaws in someone else than yourself.’
It was just nature’s course. A child’s maturity level.
Mikhail didn’t feel anything about it. The same had happened last time.
In fact, it was much worse last time as the squadron’s that didn’t lose a member were not more than 3 or 4.
The treatment they got was much worse but Mikhail’s squadron couldn’t care less.
Not that time and not this time.
They were only concerned with themselves and the well-being of their family.
’As it should be.’
If only these people were able to reach this level of understanding.
To become strong enough to protect yourself rather than seek protection from the strong.
Just like how they did with Dominique.
’Too naive. Too weak.’
Mikhail concluded calmly.
One of their weakest traits.
However, there was another difference this time around.
A major difference that wasn’t present the last time.
And Mikhail knew what it was. Even his squadron felt it.
"Mikhail," Icarus called from the back.
He didn’t answer so he continued.
"Why are a lot of them glaring at you instead of us?"
It was true.
A large majority of the glares directed their way weren’t at his squadron.
It was at him. Mikhail Hendrix, 1st Platoon Leader in the raid.
"I’m sorry Mika-" Yvan apologized from the back.
But Mikhail was quick to make him stop.
"Don’t."
Turning his face for the first time, he looked him dead in the eye with his blue calm eyes.
"I wasn’t able to say it before but, you did a great job handling the platoon in my stead."
He took a pause.
"No one could have done it better than you and I mean it."
He genuinely did.
In all of the deaths that had been reported to him by Modric, only a record 6 deaths were from the 1st Platoon.
Only 6.
He couldn’t be more proud of the way he handled that large of a platoon.
Especially considering he had no experience in doing so.
"It’s their fault for being weak. They need a target to channel all this hatred into. Now that they found one, the best you can do is ignore and focus on yourself."
At Mikhail’s compliment, Yvan was left speechless just like the hospital.
Everyone knew how much Yvan admired Mikhail.
Well, everyone in the squadron did but Yvan’s devotion to Mikhail was something else.
He quickly nodded/
"Y-yes, I understand." he tried to calm himself, now fixing his expression.
If Mikhail had appreciated him, he needed nothing more.
"Good."
Turning back to the front, Mikhail focused on himself.
He didn’t want to make his squadron feel the pressure from these glares or opinions.
That was all he thought about.
The hatred directed at him personally? Mikhail couldn’t find himself caring a damn about it.
It wasn’t the first time and it wasn’t going to be the last one.
’Just a natural process.’
Focusing back on the ground, Mikhail saw the substitute staff finally enter the ground.
Since Vlahovic was in recovery, they were the ones handling the squadrons.
Mikhail knew what they were assembled for here today.
It was going to be the same as last time.
A small way of keeping them busy until the academy got back on track.
And that was...
"Assessment Tests."
Yes, they were going to be tested for their fitness and mental strength.
Especially after how many were left traumatized after the attack.
________________

chapters.title: Chapter 24: The Truth In The Lies
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: The Truth In The Lies
"Good morning everyone." Master Avalon greeted the cadets.
Unlike usual, there was no response from the cadets.
It was clear that the mourning air of death was still there after a week.
But here was the difference...
"Let’s continue on our normal schedule," he said.
But as he was about to continue, a voice came from the crowd.
"Do you guys really don’t feel anything over what happened?"
It wasn’t anything more than a whisper.
But in the silence of the large ground, it echoed like a haunting question.
"Hmm?" Avalon turned, his eyes now toward the cadet who spoke out from the Squadron.
"Elionor Marvin from Squadron 24, speak clearly on what you mean."
There was no expression of annoyance or irritation on Avalon’s face.
It was completely calm.
The respective cadet, Elionor, finally couldn’t take it anymore as he raised his voice.
"Are you people just going to ignore what happened a week ago!?"
He came walking out the squadron.
"Those people risked our lives with us to save this academy!"
He started shouting now.
"Yet! You people couldn’t even give them a proper funeral!?"
There was complete silence in the ground as Elionor shouted.
His voice echoed in the large space, right into the ears of the Avalon, who was calm as ever.
"You, you people couldn’t even protect your own castle!"
His voice finally died down, reducing the noise in the ground back to the whispers of the wind.
Mikhail observed the situation silently with his squadron.
’As said, these people are too weak and naive.’
At this point, they were just finding reasons to put the blame on.
Their weakness was too hard to accept.
Mikhail’s eyes turned to Avalon, waiting to see his response to the words.
And after a few seconds of silence, Avalon turned back to his original position.
"There. These few seconds of silence are enough for their honor."
Facing the cadets, he was about to speak again when Elionor tried to shout again.
"You can’t-"
Unfortunately for him, Avalon was done with his bullshit.
This was the moment that the men of Castle Blackmire would finally understand their worth.
And Mikhail had been waiting for it.
Taking the gun out by his waist, Avalon pulled the trigger.
BOOM!
The shot travelled straight past Elionor’s head, grazing his cheek.
The boy’s eyes widened with horror and panic as if his life just flashed past him in a second.
"A little to the right and you would’ve been dead."
Avalon strapped the gun back to his waist.
"Now tell me, if you were to die right here, who would’ve retaliated to your death?"
His question was heard loud and clear in the ground, the silence as flat as ever.
Elionor, who had collapsed to his knees in fear, was unable to answer.
His mind was still reeling from the shock of how close he had been to death.
Step.
Avalon started walking toward him.
"Your squadron?"
His sharp black eyes went to the squadron he came from, searching for answers.
Elionor’s trembling eyes turned to the back, only for a horrified gasp to escape his lips.
All of them..
Not a single one was meeting his gaze.
All of them had been reduced to absolute rats with one shot of the gun.
"None." Avalon finally reached him, his eyes locking down on him from above.
"In fact, I’ll ask this, which person from here would even bother to mourn your death if you were to die here?"
"Look around and see. Raise your hand if you would mourn for him."
But this time, Elionor was too defeated to even try. The reality had been too harsh on him.
Unfortunately, it would only get worse for him as a crunching kick was delivered to his cheek.
CRACK! THUD!
Blood spilled in the air as Elionor’s face slammed on the ground.
"None. That’s your worth in this world."
Grabbing the boy’s bloody face by the hair, Avalon pulled him up close to his head.
"You, to me, to the Empire, to these people are nothing more than a mere speck of dirt."
At this point, there was not a single spark of rebuttal left in Elionor’s eyes, with tears streaming down his face.
"Honor and respect is never fully earned. That’s a fat lie."
Avalon spat on the ground.
"It’s half-given from your birth and half you have to earn. But your respect and honor?"
A smirk spread on Avalon’s face.
"The only respect you were given at birth is to be discarded by your parents to the hold rather than being buried alive at a day old."
Avalon let go of Elionor’s hair, letting him fall to the ground, now completely broken.
"If these people who died had done enough in this world, then they would’ve definitely been honored. Not just the camp but the whole world."
He started walking away.
"But the problem?"
Avalon turned back.
"You people think too highly of yourselves. Too important. Too worthy."
Mikhail listened to the whole truth with a calm expression.
He knew a lot of people were getting butt hurt right now.
But unfortunately, that was the cruel truth.
The best thing you could do was just accept it.
"But the reality?"
Avalon spat on the ground.
"You sit at the lowest of the lowest in this world. Thrown out of the wall like trash."
He pointed to the spit on the ground.
"In the eyes of the Empire, this spit holds more value than your life."
He started walking back to his original position.
"So don’t come crying about respect and honor. If you had enough respect, the Dominique wouldn’t have watched you die like insects that day."
Every word of his stabbed into the hearts of the cadet like a hot knife.
"So realize that you aren’t even the worth of a normal human. You are worthless and the fact that none of you can say anything about it, proves it as the absolute truth."
He ended his speech, the ground still in the echoing silence as it was before.
Elionor’s body lay on the ground, now defeated and broken.
’A clear delivery of truth to the cadets.’
And the defeated expression on everyone’s face clearly showed it.
"Now, let’s continue."
_______________

chapters.title: Chapter 25: The Second Mission
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: The Second Mission
"Let’s move on to today’s task. Assignments."
The whole ground was completely silent after his speech, now focusing on his words.
"Since the camp is still in reconstruction, most of the drill routes can’t be checked. The stables aren’t in the best of conditions right now."
Mikhail already knew that and so did probably everyone else.
"So in the meantime, we have decided to conduct your assignments ahead of schedule."
Assignments weren’t something new to everyone.
They were conducted every 6 months in the camp.
Basically, they were a series of tests conducted to see who was in shape and who needed working.
It helped to see who was the strongest, who was above who and all that.
These tests included everything from one-on-one spars, to physical exercises, to mental examinations.
No one in his squadron had ever failed them so there was nothing in it for them to be afraid of.
If anything, Mikhail was hoping for these to see how far he had come with all these bonuses.
It was a good thing that they were being conducted early this time.
"Due to the reconstruction, even in the assignments, some exercises can’t be conducted due to unavailability of their facilities."
’Makes sense.’
Avalon continued, making the most surprising news for them now.
