But at least, he knew how to reveal the oath now.
After a month in this world, he knew the ropes around this new system now.
He basically needed to do the missions and the Character Progression would gradually reveal his oath and his past memories.
’Well, if it works like this, then fine by me.’
He still needed to find on what basis the missions were given to him though.
It would make it easier for him to predict the future ones and be more prepared.
Because he was only a misstep away from losing his life away in the first mission.
Lost in his thoughts, Mikhail didn’t realize when he was back at the castle grounds.
He was quite hungry so he headed straight to the kitchen where most of them were seated.
Only one category was left now.
One-on-One spars.
They were to take place in some hours so everyone could rest well.
Entering the mess, he saw his squadron already seated at the table.
"You’re back, congratulations." Modric congratulated him and started clapping.
The rest of them joined in with him.
Mikhail was sure they hadn’t even heard the news yet because they knew he would come first.
Every year, they started clapping without even hearing the marks first.
Mikhail gave them a slight smile.
"Thanks." He sat down on the last empty seat on their table.
Mikhail saw other people on the tables stare down at him too, but speak nothing.
Just like his squadron they had come to terms with the fact that he’d come first.
But as the people who gave the tests came from behind him, the kitchen turned into a staring session.
All of them were staring at him.
And of course, Icarus was immediately to point that out.
"Why is everyone from the tests staring at you like that? Did you kill a bastard on your way up or something?"
"Pfft-" Oscar restricted a laugh.
While on the other hand, Mikhail heard the creaking of several tables as the men were shaking in their toes to get up and start a fight.
Unfortunately, all the masters and Vlahovic were seated above too.
Mikhail saw other people who weren’t at the tests stare at him too, waiting for an answer.
Letting out a deep breath, Mikhail answered their queries.
"I broke my own record. Scoring 81, I was almost 8 whole minutes faster than the second place."
For a moment, Mikhail heard some forks dropping in the kitchen.
81!? Under Vlahovic’s Test!?
"Holy gracious fuck..." Icarus said, his eyes widening as he leaned back into his chair.
There was silence in the kitchen as the people tried to contemplate what Mikhail had just said.
As for the man himself, he was restricting himself from sighing.
He hated these types of moments. This quest was already piling a million problems on his head for the future.
And one was already about to start soon.
"Fuck this bastard." The silence was broken by a familiar voice from behind Mikhail.
Turning, he saw Cameron’s huge body staring down at his seat in anger.
He was glaring so hard that his eyeballs were almost popping out.
"This bastard definitely cheated!" He shouted, trying to grab Mikhail.
Mikhail didn’t even dare to dodge the hand as the guy was already thrown into the wall before it reached him.
Nobody saw what happened as it all happened in the blink of an eye.
Looking to his right, Mikhail saw Master Avalon dusting his hands.
"If you don’t want to eat your food then take your complaints down your ass."
As he was about to disappear again, Mikhail saw Avalon glare at him as well.
It was apparent that he was also displeased with the result.
But at least the man wasn’t delusional enough to not accept it.
As the others saw Cameron’s body smashed into the wall unconscious, they quietly went back to their own meal.
It was better to just accept the result now.
After all, how much more could they deny it?
The man in front of them was just a natural monster at everything.
What he was doing at the Ironhold and not in the Empire’s Army or in a Church’s ranks had them confused.
Well they couldn’t complain. He had saved their asses after all in the attack.
________

chapters.title: Chapter 38: Where It All Goes Wrong
chapters.content:
Chapter 38: Where It All Goes Wrong
It was finally time.
For the one-on-one spars.
Unlike what one would expect, this wasn’t a whole tournament.
After all they were just evaluating the progress of the men and these were simple assignments.
The process was simple.
Every man was pitted against two other men of closest strength to him.
Each fight earned you a score.
50 for winning the fight or 25 if you lost. And the rest 50 was for how fast you beat your opponent, how much damage you took yourself and other factors.
There weren’t many men on the hold so it didn’t require many people to supervise the fights either.
2 fights would be overseen by one single higher up which were further overseen by a Master, who would be overseeing 10 fights.
The score would be given by the masters. The higher up was just there to ensure no cheating or something bad would happen.
So in a sense, Mikhail could only fight 2 people too.
Whether they would be from his squadron or not, it would be seen later.
The matchups were decided through a mutual agreement by the Masters.
Reporting to the drill grounds where the fights would take place, Mikhail saw several pieces of papers pinned to the wooden pillars.
They were the matchups for every cadet.
Mikhail and his squadron waited for the crowd to disperse before going over to look for themselves.
And they were quick to find their matchups.
For Mikhail, it was:
Mikhail Hendrix vs Loriel Marthford
Mikhail Hendrix vs Modric Sylbane
Oh.
Loriel was the Commander of Squadron 19, he was famous as the best spearman in the castle.
As for the other matchup, it was the one Mikhail was most excited for.
His fight with Modric.
Mikhail looked at his squadron’s matchups too.
Modric was apparently matched up with James for his second match.
Oscar and Icarus were paired against each other so that would be an exciting battle.
Yvan was paired against someone from Squadron 17 and against Julian.
Even as a supporter of his own squadron, Mikhail could see very little possibility where he could squeeze past Julian.
The latter had jumped a lot in strength.
But he still believed in Yvan.
However, despite all their interesting matchups, Mikhail still saw a sad expression on their faces.
And he knew exactly why.
"It’s fine, these assignment tests aren’t the only time we can fight against each other." He tapped them on their shoulder.
"Cheer up," he said.
"Yeah he’s right, remember the stronger you get, the more chances you have. This should be a source of motivation for us." Oscar tried to be positive.
"Oscar’s right. This is why you should train more Mikhail, so you can hopefully get a chance to be paired against me next time." Icarus tapped him on the back.
"You pipsqueak." Mikhail smiled at the joke.
The group laughed together, the mood considerably better now.
As everyone was now confirmed about their matchups, the door to the central building opened finally.
And all the Masters walked out, directing everyone’s attention to them.
"It’s time for the final stretch of the assignment tests, the one-on-one spars." Avalon announced.
"Hopefully, after all these results, you all will continue to improve upon your results for the next time."
Vlahovic nodded.
"Indeed, we hope that the castle will be back to its full capabilities soon too so we can resume our normal operations," he said.
"Now, without further ado,"
Avalon nodded to the higher ups standing below.
"Start the matches."
***
[After Some Hours]
Mikhail saw multiple matches pass by, but none of his own yet.
The scores were to be told to the men as a combination of both fights at the end.
Modric had to fight against James whom he was able to beat in a span of 5 minutes.
While he did have a physical edge against him and put Modric in considerable difficulty, the latter was able to lure him into his traps effortlessly.
It was only a matter of time before the knight fell.
Unfortunately, the time could prove costly to his scores.
At the same time, the same couldn’t be said for Yvan.
Though he beat his first opponent in the snap of an eye, he struggled to adapt against Julian.
As a Magus who focused on Materialistic Essentia, it was expected for him to win against Julian, the opposite.
Unfortunately, the skill gap was too big.
That didn’t mean Yvan went down without a fight though.
In fact, in some parts of the fight Julian was forced into very tight situations that Mikhail could barely see anyone else getting out of.
However, Julian being the quick shadow he was, was able to squeeze past.
Though he did win, it wasn’t an easy fight.
And Mikhail was proud of Yvan, giving him his support.
Currently, it was Oscar vs Icarus going on.
And it was safe to say none of them were willing to give up.
Both of them being exceptional Cindralis users, the whole area was turning into a battle of flames.
Even the other spectators had shifted their attention to the fight.
Watching them all made Mikhail realize that they had gotten stronger.
Stronger than they were at this point in his last life.
And the reason for that was obviously him, though he didn’t know at what point he made it.
All in all, he was very happy with all of them and their development.
However, there was still something nagging in the back of his mind.
At this point, everyone in the ground had faced their first match.
Everyone except..
Mikhail.
Something wasn’t normal, though he was unable to tell what.
Taking his eye away from the fight, he looked up.
Straight to the Masters.
And then..
’..!’
He found Vlahovic looking right back at him through the flames.
He knew it.
Something was definitely not right.
But he couldn’t pinpoint what.
Was the man trying to tell him something?
Mikhail saw a deep sadness in his eyes. He didn’t know what it meant.
It was as if he was apologizing to him.
Mikhail’s heart pounded against him.
All this time, everything had been going right in the assignment tests.
At what point did something turn wrong? What had he overlooked?
’Shit, I’m panicking.’
Mikhail tried to calm himself, taking a deep breath.
It was alright.
Maybe he was just stressing too much over it.
Even if it was an issue, Mikhail didn’t see it being anything like the previous attack.
If so, Vlahovic wouldn’t have been sitting still. He would have known and he would be ready right now.
If it was just something minor, Mikhail could handle it.
He was certain he could.
Suddenly, a voice shook him out of his reverie.
"Winner, Icarus Heliarke." The announcer raised Icarus’ hand as everyone started clapping.
"And now for the next fight, Mikhail-"
"That won’t be needed." A sharp feminine voice cut right through the grounds.
One that had everyone shaking and rooted in their spots.
Mikhail’s eyes trembled at the thought.
Everyone knew that voice. It was all too familiar.
It had just been with them not too long ago after all.
Strengthening himself, Mikhail raised his shivering eyes to look up.
And there she was.
Celine Strathorne.
’..!’
With her violet eyes staring right at him.
_______________
This is the last free Chapter folks.
I hope you enjoyed the ride till here and keep supporting the novel!!

chapters.title: Chapter 39: Interruption
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: Interruption
Mikhail’s back was covered in sweat as he made contact with Celine.
’What the he-’
The very next moment, she disappeared from his sight.
But before Mikhail could even register the move, he felt someone beside him.
"Hmm..."
Her face was so near him that he could feel her breath as her violet eyes peered into him.
It was as if he was being skinned mentally, layer by layer without even him realizing it.
That was the power of a Dominique.
Mikhail did not dare to move. More like his body couldn’t even if he tried.
"Hmm..." Celine hummed, raising her hand.
Her delicate fingers touched Mikhail’s cold cheek.
He felt their warmth despite it being as cold as a blizzard.
Celine ran down her fingers to the side of his face to his chin, before lifting his face up.
"I was right."
Her voice echoed in the silence of the ground, where everyone stood in shock.
Mikhail’s clothes were now drenched in sweat.
Her mana field was so thick, it was making him suffocate.
But finally, she removed her sight from him.
Her face turned straight to the stands, where her eyes met Vlahovic.
The latter instantly bowed his head.
"Milady," he said.
"I’ll be taking this boy with me," she replied, wasting no time.
Before the words or the shock could even settle in the ground or even in Mikhail, Celine had already acted.
A humongous gust enveloped her and Mikhail covering them before breaking the next second.
Only that the two weren’t there anymore.
They were gone.
***
Before Mikhail could understand what happened, the gust around him disappeared.
Only that he wasn’t in the castle anymore.
Around him was white and white all around with thick long trees that stretched above into the sky.
Mikhail knew where he was.
He was beyond the hold now.
And not just at any point..
It was the place where he had fought the Silent Pact.
He could still see some dry faint marks of blood and the broken remains of trees.
’Why am I back-’
"We are here finally." Celine interrupted his thoughts as she let go of his chin.
Mikhail’s eyes widened as he was reminded that she was beside him.
’I couldn’t even notice her.’
She was well beyond his league.
He was quickly about to make distance before Celine interrupted again.
"I won’t kill you,"
Fuck.
He realized that he was panicking, making him read him like a book.
Mikhail took a deep breath, trying to calm himself.
But..
"At least not yet."
Suddenly, an invisible slice of wind cut through the air.
It was so fast that before he could even understand what she did, Mikhail felt something trickle down his cheek.
A shiver ran down Mikhail’s spine.
’Too fast.’
He felt the blood slide down his cheek to his neck.
Drip.
Swish.
As he felt a drop of blood drop from his neck, another blade cut through the air.
And for the second time, Mikhail felt wet on the other side of his cheek.
Celine’s indifferent violet eyes were staring right into his blue ones.
Despite the stings of pain, he did not dare break contact or make a move.
He felt as if the moment he did, his body would be sliced into pieces.
"Impressive instincts."
Her graceful voice cut through the air into his ears.
In the next second, Mikhail saw her relax her fingers.
Before she spoke again,
"Go on, give it your all. Hit me."
’Hu-’
What kind of deathly command was-
"If you can so much manage to even hit me once, I’ll grant you anything."
Before Mikhail could speak, she reaffirmed her words.
"Anything."
From this, he knew she meant anything.
Their freedom, wealth, power, her life.
Anything, she was willing to bet.
Mikhail knew it was easier said than done though.
It was almost impossible.
"I won’t attack back or even move from my spot."
He wanted to tell her that those didn’t improve his chances.
Only negated of him being dead during the challenge.
’Here goes.’
Mikhail took a deep breath readying himself.
He knew he was going to fail eitherway.
Definitely without his Oath and Dragma.
Raising his hands, Mikhail formed a spell circuit.
"Cindr-"
"Your all."
Celine’s voice echoed through the air, disrupting his spell.
Shivers ran down Mikhail’s spine but he calmed himself down.
He restricted a sigh.
He didn’t know why he was planning for her to not know.
After all he had seen, it was apparent he had been severely underestimating her.
Especially his Dragma. He had been kind of hoping that she wouldn’t see it.
Well, whatever.
Turning to her, Mikhail readied himself on his feet again.
The next second, the ground cracked under his feet as he shot forward.
Since she had given her word to not attack back or move, there was no harm in getting closer.
He didn’t trust her but it was better to take her word for it.
After all, he had nothing to lose. If she wanted to attack, she could have killed him in a second.
Closing the distance between them, Mikhail took out one of his guns.
With his free hand, he performed spell signs in quick succession.
He needed to focus right now.
The chance that he could hit her even from a millimeters distance was equivalent to finding a needle in a haystack.
"Cindralis Morphis."
BOOM!
A streak of red shot through the meter that was left between Mikhail and Celine.
Mikhail’s blue eyes watched as the bullet neared her before..
Whoosh.
The flames died out and the bullet was cleanly caught between Celine’s fingers.
It was as if it gradually slowed down before suddenly halting perfectly in her fingers.
For a moment, he was captured in awe of her powers.
But he had no time to spare, he needed to give her no time to relax.
It was the only way he could force an opening, allowing him a chance to attack.
This time, he took out both of his guns, resorting to pre-spells.
"Cindralis Morphis. Aqualis Morphis."
Boom. Boom.
Rather than waiting for the bullets to land this time, Mikhail shot forward too.
Just like last time, the streak of crimson and blue neared Celine before suddenly dying out in her fingers.
However, she was given no room to breathe.
As Mikhail was already under her sight now, within striking distance.
Letting both of his guns go, he performed signs in quick succession once more.
"Cindralis Hurrialis."
WHOOSH!
A torrent of flames erupted from his arms, enveloping Celine whole.
But within a second, Mikhail was grabbed by his neck and pulled close from within the flames.
The torrent died out a second later and he came face to face with Celine, who stared deep into his eyes once more.
"Is that truly your all?"
